Summary: Room was better than expected, large, and had many amenities. However, the AC made the room smell odd when left on, and the window opened fully instead of the typical few inches which was a little worrisome. The public spaces could use more regular cleaning. There was a strange bag of unclaimed clothing in the laundry room for over 48 hours, and bad smells in the hallways and stairways throughout the stay. We experienced genuine friendliness from all of the room attendants we encountered. Some of the front desk staff seemed a little too casual and a step below traditional Marriott service standards.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect if going to Angel Stadium
Summary: Easy walk to Angel Stadium (we had a 4 and 5 year old with us). Room was clean and spacious. Will definitely be keeping in mind for future visits. Only complaint was the late check in. We would have liked to check in earlier than 4pm.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel for the past several years. Unfortunately, each year it seems to be going downhill. The room was smelly, the AC did not work, the floor seem to be mopped with oil rather than water, The towels were old and crusty and it seems the front desk could not control their guests. I will not be returning.  And then oddly enough, I receive an email from the GM asking for a good review? Begging?
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for business accomodations in the area.
Summary: Everything was as expected.  Nice hotel, friendly staff, good breakfasts, convenient location. I have stayed here over, and over again.  The hotel is in such a convenient location for business travel to the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not worth the rate / reward points you pay. The room quality is poor and very old style. Room carpet was greasy and bathrooms don't even have a lock system. Staff though is friendly and helpful. The breakfast spread is also good, but can't enjoy as the room is very small to accommodate more than 4-5 families at a time. You literally have to stand and eat your breakfast if you visit at peak times. Will not recommend - definitely not expected from Marriott brand.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and a friendly staff
Summary: Everyone was friendly. Room was a little bit cramped for 3 people but it worked since we stayed for a few hours. Breakfast buffet had a nice selection of hot and healthy items. Will stay here again if we are in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hello Mr.Woon  my stay at your facility was horrible your facility was great but Rafael  The nighttime counter guy need to be fired he doesn’t know the difference between a hold in the bank account he thinks we can still use that money which is completely incorrect the money put aside by the bank so we can’t use it made available to you so on the last day there they overcharged me on incidentals so the card didn’t go through any more final end of that situation was meet me and me escorted by cops out of the hotel  also he was very very bad customer service from the beginning how to spend two nights outside without a place to go he also told me if I didn’t if I only had $200 on a car that should not be staying there when my incidentals should’ve been 50 $ Your Pl. charge me $50 a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our Disney vacation and checked in on my birthday. The staff at the hotel went out of there way to make the stay special. They had treats, balloons, and decorations waiting for me! Cassandra, Rafael, and Patrick were really wonderful and made us feel welcome. We really appreciated their friendly attitudes and excellent service! The rooms were nice and big, and the breakfast in the morning was delicious! The kids loved the bear shaped waffles, and we liked the yummy sausage and eggs! My husband and I have been once before with just the two of us and plan on coming every time we come to Disneyland! Overall and excellent hotel with an even better staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was great, very nice and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms... something was wrong with the room we reserved and they upgrated us to two independent contected suites. I definitily stay here again. Thanks guys!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I went to check in, one of the member(Rafael) helped me out with my booking issue . He was one of the best member in that hotel. He helped me out so much and I can’t thank him enough. Rafael was amazing!! 100/100 great would go to that hotel again . Thank you again RAFAEL!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: For a Marriott, it's not the best, very dated and old. Service was okay, cleanliness lacking, looked like the cleaning of the rooms was just empty trash and make the beds. Just needs an update and lessons on cleaning, front desk was very nice. Breakfast was good as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Won't be retuning & avoid if you have families
Summary: My wife had stayed here a couple years ago and thought this would be the perfect stay for our son's first trip to Disneyland. The night we checked in our hotel room hallway reeked of Marijuana. I brought it up to the concierge and he offered to move us and gave us some gift bags, but my wife already had settle my son down for the night. Next day our room was not cleaned & we then had to bring it up to the concierge that housekeeping never came by. Second night was ok. Third day, room got cleaned, but coming back from Disneyland later that night, the first floor of the hotel once again reeked of Marijuana.  Look I get this is California, but with how many families are coming and going to disneyland I can't believe this is acceptable.  Only reason this is getting a 2 star rating
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst Marriott in History and I should know I’ve had 75 nights in a Marriott this year
Summary: Dirty, outdated, the room shook from the road construction which is an unfortunate coincidence but the train goes by with horn blasting frequently. It was the worst stays.  We checked out of this complimentary free room earned from points to pay at a Sheraton.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our daughter performed in the candlelight at Disneyland.  This place was a perfect stay.  We've stayed at many hotels in the Anaheim area but will continue to stay here for our visits.  The breakfast was a great start and we took uber to get to Disneyland.  No parking fees at this hotel.  We had a wonderful stay and the gentleman at the front desk was always so welcoming.  Will definitely stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I are disney annual pass holders and have stayed at towne place suites three times. Every morning we go down at 6:30 to have Marcela's wonderful breakfast and hospitality. The people there are nice and remember us, I highly recommend this hotel and will be returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for your fantastic review of our property! We're glad to hear that Marcela is able to provide you with excellent service every stay. We hope that we can continue to serve you well in the future. Happy holidays and a Happy New Year!

Summary: Breakfast was poorly mismanaged.  Minimally staffed and she was unable to keep up with the demand of stocking coffee, eggs, milk, cheese, etc.  Not to mention -- VERY limited seating. Five in a room and only towels for 4.  When I requested more-- there were none available. Pull-out sofa was stained and had food crumbs throughout. Management passes the buck to department heads.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property. We're sorry to hear that you did not have a truly memorable stay with us and will work towards correcting the issues you had experienced. We hope that we will have the opportunity to serve you better in your future visits to Anaheim.

Summary: This is an excellent place to stay in Anaheim. It’s conveniently located near major highways, comfortable and spacious rooms and at a great price! Free WiFi, free self parking and free breakfast! You can’t go wrong staying here!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review of the property! We're so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were able to enjoy some of our amenities. We hope that we can continue to provide you with excellent service in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: The overall stay was ok but two out of the three mornings our showers were luke warm almost cold and the desk clerk told me it was because of the cold temperature outside was affecting the pipes and thus the colder than normal showers.   I smiled and told him “ok” knowing that is completely false.  Definitely not something that I would expect from a Marriott Property.  We were in room 320.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for three nights and four days and I have to say on behalf of my wife and daughters, this is one of the best hotels that we've stayed in. The service was one of the best that we have received in all of the years traveling to different places. Cassandra, who was the front desk assistant, was one of the best person's we have dealt with in our travels. She was very courteous and professional. We got there Monday morning and she had our room ready before 8am, welcome us to have breakfast, and gave us all the required information to make our trip to Disneyland, one of the best ever. She was there all three days that we stayed and she was very courteous and happy to help. The rest of the hotel staff was also so "COURTEOUS" and always smiling. Room was cleaned every
Manager Response: Thanks for your fantastic review of our property! We're glad to hear that Cassandra was able to give you an excellent experience! We look forward to the opportunity to serve you in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: I always try to stay at this hotel when I am in town for Disneyland or hockey games! The staff is always so pleasant and accommodating! I especially wanted to thank Joy who goes above and beyond every time I have stayed at or called this property. Joys professionalism made this stay even better as it was my nephews birthday. This property has so much to offer such as full kitchens, a great location, breakfast, close fwy access, walkable to food and also a nearby church. Thanks you guys!  Would definitely return!
Manager Response: Thanks for your excellent review of our property! We're glad to hear that Joy was able to make your stay extra special! We look forward to serving you in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Good room but smoke alarm light over the bed kept us awake
Summary: The full kitchen was great, and it had a little living room we really appreciated. But I wouldn't stay here again. The bedroom smoke alarm had a bright green light that shone down directly onto the bed covers over us. It woke us up throughout the night. Also, appreciated the free breakfast but there wasn't much and the dining area is really small.

Summary: The people were friendly but didn’t have any rooms cleaned til 1 1/2 hours after check in pool was gross not sure it was cleaned this year and certainly was not like the photos they show on web site,and if you were to use pool they only have hair towels to dry off
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location was excellent and the customer service was okay. I usually dont have my room cleaned during the week because I'm an adult and should clean up after myself but the Do Not Disturb sign was not in my room. And I could not get over how musty the hallway and room smelled.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Second time at this location, the person at the front desk was very welcoming and professional.  The rooms need some updating.    It didn't feel as modern as other Marriotts .  The breakfast area needs to be bigger.  It was very crowed and not enough space to sit and eat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: excellent, perfect for traveling with kids, enough space for one king suite, full kitchen, full bathroom. Also very close to a lot of attractions, friendly & excellent front desk, will come back here again

Summary Heading: Wow but in a negative way
Summary: Staff was friendly but the physical shape of the rooms is terrible. Interior corridors stank as di teh first room given to us. The kitchenette area is very constricted. Second room also had an odor. Pool was locked down for maintenance. Exterior door to hallway did not lock allowing anyone to enter hall

From our room looking dirty and worn down, to a musty odor that covered the entire suite it was horrible. Parts of the carpet in our suite were coming up and other parts were missing, this place looks like they tried to do a refresh with new paint but a full remodel is definitely overdue!   Prior to check in at the hotel, we checked in on the app and requested the room be ready early as we were driving out from Phoenix and we wanted to freshen up before dinner with our friends. When we arrived, we were told that our room was not ready and it wouldn't be until 4 pm. I have never had an issue with getting a room early!  We had reserved a room with a queen bed, but

Summary: great, convenient and accessible facility---- excellent staff----great service and clean well run hotel---part of MARRIOTT group- they went above and beyond when i had some special considerations----which they  quickly accomodated and resolved-!
Manager Response: Thanks for your excellent review of our property! We've shared your comments with the staff so that they can continue to deliver excellent service. Once again, thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim and we hope to serve you in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: First time walking in and a strong ammonia/ dirty wet floor scent hits you hard. We called and a worker came only to tell us they painted the rooms last week. Obviously the rooms were not aired out accordingly. Minus the headache I got, we kept the windows open all day and all night only to hear the train passing hourly and the late night foot traffic coming back. There was mildew in the shower and the shower curtain was not water proof so we had an inch of water outside the tub after showering. The kitchen area was nice but a little outdated. The bed was not what I was expecting booking with a Marriott family hotel. It was slightly hard and uncomfortable. However, the staff was quick to respond with requests such as additional towels and TV not working. It was obvious repairs
Manager Response: Thanks for the informative review of our property. We've passed along your message to the appropriate departments to ensure that this does not happen again. Once again, thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim. We hope to serve you better in the future.

Summary: It was a nice hotel to stay with family, however I called days ahead of my reservation to make sure that we had a close room to the entrance. I am 7 months pregnant, have a 2 year old, and my husband is an amputee. Not only did our request to have a closer room was not granted and we weren’t notified until the day of check in, our room was the last room down the hall making it super inconvenient. With the phones in the room, there was no way to get ahold of the lobby for extra pillows or blankets needed for the sofa bed as it was VERY uncomfortable. You can feel the metal on your back. On the day of check out, the elevators were out. So we had to carry everything down the stairs. We did have someone help and we told him to wait at the bottom so we can show him where the car was

Summary Heading: Staff was super hospitable and welcoming
Summary: The Staff there made me feel like family.  Remember everyone in my group, always had a pleasant smile as they welcomed me in the morning for breakfast, and assisted in any questions I had regarding the area.  Marcia in the mornings is super nice!
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review of our property! We're happy to hear that you had such a great stay with us and that our breakfast staff was able to make you feel like family. Thank you and we hope to see you in your future travels to Anaheim!

Summary: They were over booked and they downgraded our room. Check in is at 4 and rooms weren't ready. The room smelled horribly and the beds are tiny. Would not stay here again especially for the price we paid.
Manager Response: Thanks for your informative review of our property. We have shared your comments with the appropriate departments to ensure that this was an isolated incident. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim and we hope that we have the opportunity to provide you with a more memorable experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice property, but badly in need of maintenance
Summary: We spent 5 nights at this property, and the hotel staff was among the most friendly and helpful we have encountered in a long time.  The property though is badly in need of maintenance.  The outdoor barbecue doesn't work, the bottom of the pool plaster is badly worn/peeling, the ice machine was out of order and our room had very worn, raveled carpeting.  If they fixed these things, my rating would be higher. Great location though and once again FRIENDLY personnel, something that seems to  badly be lacking in the other Marriott properties we have recently stayed at in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The 2 bedroom suites were clean and quite large, comes with free wifi and free self parking. Location is excellent and is close to many restaurants.  There is a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland and back. Disneyland is about a 5-10 mins drive. The buffet breakfast is fantastic and had a good variety of food. Their coffee is actually quite good as well! Staff was super nice and helpful.   There are 2 computers for use in the lobby. I was able to check in for my flight and print my boarding pass as well.   Definately will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was so disappointed in the rooms at this location. I have stayed at Marriotts many times and so was excited to see one so close to where my son was getting married. We booked suites for us and all in the bridal party. I was so unhappy with the rooms I also booked rooms at the Ayres in Anaheim so we could have more space. ( the Ayres is a great hotel). The breakfast buffet is a joke. They hardly refill anything in a timely manner and it is a mess that never seems to get cleaned up. There are very few tables to sit at for that big of a complex. The rooms are dingy and there is only one awful couch to sit on in the room. Our room was handicapped access and it made no sense that the chair in the bedroom area and couch is so low someone disabled can't get out of them. I will be
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property. We aim to provide the best experience to our guests but it seems we have fallen short. We will pass along your comments to the appropriate departments to ensure that these issues do not occur again. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you better in the future.

Summary Heading: Not up to the Marriott standard yet has the Marriott price.
Summary: I want to begin by saying the room price with tax was $269. That price is what I have paid in the past to stay in a Marriott in San Diego with a view of the water.  The lady who checked us in said she only had an ADA room available. I thought it strange but we accepted the room. The shower in that room had visible mold. The room was stuffy and had an odd smell. The room was also well worn. I went back to the front desk and asked for a different room. The lady gave us a different room in the same building and it wasn't an ADA room. She also volunteered to take $20 off for the inconvenience. The second room looked a lot cleaner but was still worn and not as clean as it should have been. I am still perplexed as to why she initially said she only had the dirty ADA room. I also can't
Manager Response: Thank you for the honest review of our property. We have shared your comments with the appropriate departments to ensure that these cleanliness issues are an isolated incident and will not occur again. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you better in the future.

Summary: Our stay was wonderful, from check in to our hot breakfast, clean rooms, small kitchem and helpful tips. Will recommend to friends and business associates. Easy access to food, freeways and of course Disneyland and Angel Stadium
Manager Response: Thanks for your fantastic review! We're glad to hear that you had such a great stay with us and we look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: Both Cassandra and Joy did a nice job. I had to be relocated to another hotel because of a water line failure Cassandra did well by getting me to the other hotel and checking me back in. I went to check back in early in the morning two days later and Joy made a point of calling my office to get the credit card information and also calling me when my room was ready. Breakfast was decent as well.
Manager Response: Thanks for your excellent review! We're sorry to hear that you had to be relocated due to plumbing issues, but thankfully Joy and Cassandra were able to make your stay as excellent as possible. We look forward to being able to serve you in the future again!

Summary: Each room has a small fully equipped kitchen and free breakfast..  There is a pool and spa and overall it is a great property in a great location.  Very easy access to the 5 freeway and the 57 freeway.  Close to Angels Stadium, Duck Pond, Disneyland, and Knott's Berry Farm!
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review of our property! We're glad to hear that you had a great stay with us and hope that we can continue to service you in the future!

Summary: Check in process left us wishing we choose a different hotel ; I am a big fan of mobile check in and I even call ahead to make sure everything about my reservation is in order but during our stay here at TownePlace it didn’t matter we weren’t gonna get the service we expected as soon as we were greeted by Rafael .  The process was long and daunting and he was slow and didn’t seem enthused by our arrival.  Mobile check in was a waste as he proceeded to ask questions and request a credit card despite mine being on file and used to book and available for incidentals.  A staff member passed behind and advised “raf” that mobile check in was done and key cards were already made and check in was complete but that didn’t phase him he continued with his own process   Anyway after
Manager Response: Thank you for your in-depth review of our property. We're sorry to hear that your check-in experience was less than satisfactory, but we're glad that we were able to resolve the issues you experienced. We will pass along your comments to the appropriate departments to ensure that this is an isolated incident and will not occur again. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you and we hope that we have the chance to make your stay more memorable the next time you're in the Anaheim area.

Summary: Business trips can be painful sometimes, however staying in the Towneplace hotel makes it worth it. Especially Ashlee and Joy, always treat me like family. I’ll be looking forward to my next business trip.
Manager Response: Thanks for your thoughtful review of our property! We're glad to hear that Ashley and Joy welcome you with open arms on each of your visits. We look forward to continuing our excellent service in your future stays with us in Anaheim!

Summary: What a surprise!  I hadn’t heard of this Marriott brand before but I’m very pleased that I chose it for our quick overnight.  Key amenities for families...pool, sufficient gym, laundry, kitchenette with microwave and full size fridge.  Kids really enjoyed the hot breakfast.  We even used the beautiful bbq grill to cook steaks and saved ourselves lots of money.  But also convenient to eateries if you don’t want to cook.  Nice!
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review! We're glad to hear that you had a great time discovering the TownePlace Suites by Marriott brand hotels. We look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: Awesome and friendly employees. Joy was a very pleasant front desk person. I'm a platinum elite member so she make me feel special. Also she found my notebook that I left downstairs and headed promptly returned to my room.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review of our property and your loyalty to Marriott. We're excited that we were able to provide service that was above and beyond your expectations. We hope that we can continue to provide stellar service to you in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: Great front desk. Quick check in.  Room was ready.  This hotel has a good location, walking distance to the Grove Theater and Angel Stadium. Nice clean rooms.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Hi Carolyn,  Thanks for your great review of our property! We're so glad to hear that you had such an enjoyable stay with us. We hope that we can continue to provide excellent service to you in your future visits to Anaheim!.

Summary Heading: Good location, clean rooms, nice staff
Summary: The hotel has a great location, easy parking, and nice staff. They were able to check me in several hours early which was helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet.  If you’re looking for a hotel within walking distance to the Angels stadium, it’s a quick 10 minute walk.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review! We're glad to hear that we were able to accommodate an early check-in and you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: From the fantastic coustomer service from the front desk to the cute one bedroom. If ur looking for a little getaway this is the place to visit. Thanks Joy!  Definitely will be back great breakfast by the way.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review Gona58! We're so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope that we can continue to deliver excellent service in your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: Cassandra from the front desk was amazing, upon checking in, not only she fixed the mixed up reservation for us she even upgraded us to a two bedroom suite. she made us feel welcome, coming from a long drive from San Francisco to a pleasant smile by the agent at the front desk to a very comfortable accommodation was a treat. thank you Cassandra and thank you TownePlace, I will definitely recommend this place to a family and friends looking forward to come back hopefully soon :)
Manager Response: Thanks for your excellent review of our property! We're so glad to hear that Cassandra was able to make your stay more enjoyable. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim and we look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: Stayed for 2 months for official work. Good place. Breakfast is almost the same everyday. but lot of restaurants near by. wonderful location. has HBO Go. can get Starline tours arranged though the hotel as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review of our hotel! We're so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to serve you in the future!

Summary Heading: Some hassles with check in, but over all comfortable stay
Summary: The front desk was quite understaffed during the busy post Disney fireworks check in hour, but the one man behind the desk tried his best. They had overbooked the room we had reserved (one bedroom with separate living space for sleeper sofa) but accommodated us with two adjoining rooms. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was Ok, but very crowded. Over all it was a case of :you get what you pay for" as this hotel was a bit less expensive on a busy Labor Day weekend.
Manager Response: Thanks for your informative review of our property. We're sorry to hear that there were issues with your check-in, and we have shared this information with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure that this was an isolated incident. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim. We hope to serve you better in the future.

Summary: Quiet, clean and convenient location for business travelers doing work in Orange County. The staff are friendly and go above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as possible. When you finish working for the day you can walk across the street and take in an Angels game to end the day.
Manager Response: Thanks for your fantastic review of our property! We look forward to serving you in your future visits!

Summary: Staff was more than helpful, REALLY clean and comfy rooms, kitchenettes are great, breakfast was really good!!  But don't count on the transportation to Disneyland.  They sell out FAST.   Don't stress,  use LIFT!! Costs less, It's quicker and the drivers are all nice.   Back to the hotel... we lost a dog while there, still looking for him.  The ENTIRE staff took part in trying to find him, either physical search or social media blast.  And they consoled my mentality challenged sister. WONDERFUL PEOPLE!!  10 STARS!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND WE WILL RETURN!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your excellent review of our property! We hope that your furry family member makes it back safe and sound. Thanks for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim!

Summary: Staff was very nice.  Breakfast was great too.  Parking is free unlike other Anaheim hotels.  The ART shuttle comes right to the hotel to take you to Disneyland .  Only reason why I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because the sink and shower didn’t drain very fast.
Manager Response: We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! If you could please private message me regarding the sink and shower in your room it would be greatly appreciated so that it may not happen in the future. Thanks!

Summary Heading: Angels Stadium and a Win for the Rockies.
Summary: Best Pillows and comfortable bed. location... 5 minute walk to the Angels Stadium. I wish i had more time for Disney Parks etc. Its only a 40 minute drive from Ontario Airport. And 30 minutes to multiple Beaches! Try Asada Fries and Burger Boy!
Manager Response: While we would have loved to see the Angels win, we're even more thrilled that you loved your stay with us! Thanks for choosing the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim and we look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: I loved everything about this hotel. Everyone was very friendly. The rooms come with everything! Bottle openers, pots and pans,a stove, microwave, and dishes. Would definitely come again and recommend to anyone looking for a hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review! We're so happy to hear that you loved your stay. Thanks for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim!

Summary: Stayed here and was not sure how close to Angel Stadium it was. When we arrived, the stadium was so close. When we walked to the game, it was even closer than we thought. Of course I needed to walk after the free cookies they offer. Staff was great and accommodations were excellent!!
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay (and our fresh baked cookies)! Thanks for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim near Maingate! We look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: The only thing I didn’t like about this hotel is that they mean 4:00pm check in when it says it even though I called the day before I went and before booking it to make sure I got in right away I came and they still made me wait until 4:00 pm even as a gold elite member
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear that you had to wait until 4:00PM to check-in! Hopefully next time we'll be able to accommodate an early check-in for you. Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim and we look forward to serving you in the future!

Summary: Great room! It was so nice having a kitchen, great money saver!  The staff all were all very helpful and friendly. Thank you Susana for cleaning our room perfectly every day!   The free breakfast was way better than we expected!
Manager Response: We are delighted to have been your chosen hotel during your recent stay in Anaheim. It was  truly a pleasure to serve you. Summary: I come to Orange every couple of months and this is the first time at the TownePlace.  The room is comfortable and made for extended stays.  The kitchenette and desk are great as is the rest of the room.  It smelled like heavy cleaning chemicals which isn't something I normally notice.   The breakfast is mostly prepacked carb laden food except for the pre-made omelettes and  turkey sausage.  The coffee was great and the waffles looked good.  No happy hour.

Summary Heading: Room was not very clean but employees were very friendly
Summary: We were staying in San Diego but took a side trip to Disneyland. It was fine for us since we literally used the room for a few hours to sleep.  We were happy not to be here any longer than necessary since our room was not very clean. The pullout bed had old sheets on it (gross), the room smelled badly and the bathroom needed more attention.   The employees were super nice!

Fills fast as this location seems to attract a lot of families. Room was clean. Nice kitchen area to help feed the little ones so Mickey can't steal you blind. Some nice restaurant choices if you want more than a dog at the game ( not sure why, thats where they taste the best ).

Summary Heading: Like visiting your Nana or Great Aunt
Summary: Staying here is like visiting your Nana or a dear old Aunt - they do everything to make your stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible but their home is a little dated. Staff were friendly, the breakfast buffet was well attended, the car parking lot was free, the bed comfortable and the bathroom clean and tidy - and if you stay on the top floor, street-side, you get to see some of the Disney fireworks.  However, the decor is a little dated, the water saving shower head an early version with better ones now available, the carpet a little worn and the fittings are little tired. But they are not deal breakers. And like visiting your older loved ones, you can put up with these little quirks.

It was adequate for one night, but I would not choose the same size room again due to its bed size. I'm 5'9", my girlfriend is 5'4" and we were both a little restless the next morning due to the lack of bed space. The breakfast was good, but nothing to write home about. Overall, we would stay here again if we plan to attend an event at or near Angel's stadium again in the future.

The pool was small and not heated. Definitely not enough seating at breakfast. Overall not too pleased. Probably nicer hotels closer to Disney for the same price.

Summary: We’ve stayed here on two separate occasions now, both to see the Angels play. It’s within perfect walking distance to the stadium (longest park of the walk is the stadium parking lot). With plenty of food options nearby. Check-in is super fast. The first time we got a 1-bed, second time we got a 2-bedroom suite. It’s not super fancy or anything but for the price and convenience it’s still pretty nice and clean. The bed was actually pretty comfortable, and our suite bedroom was still big enough to fit a pack ‘n play for our 6-month old. The only reason I put 4 stars instead of 5 is because none of the rooms in the suite had locks on the doors, including the bathroom. But otherwise it was a very pleasant stay and I’m happy with the price we paid.

Summary: We had a great 3-night stay at the TownePlace Suites. Our room was clean and comfortable. Kids had fun at the pool - while small, still a great area for family time. The continental breakfast was amazing, we ate well every morning. The feedback I have, is the area is too small to feed more than 20 people at a time. With a hotel this big, you may want to consider adding more eating area.  The service at the hotel was top notch. Everyone was very kind to us and especially kind to my young children. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to our friends.  Also, great location to the Angels stadium.

Summary: We were initially given a room with a yapping dog barking below us.  We were also in a room next to the stairs.  For some reason, they put the bed so that the headboard is against the wall shared with the stairwell.  Every time the dog stopped barking, someone would walk in the stairwell and the noise would thunder at my head.  However, I spoke with them at the desk.  They offered to move us immediately.  Since they did not have another room like ours (a two room suite) which did not have a similar problem, the accommodated us by giving us two adjoining studios.  Once we were away from the yapping and thunder, we had a fantastic stay.  The place is clean and spacious.  If you are going to the stadium, it is right there. Summary: I'm a Marriott zealot and love staying in Marriott properties - I'm a platinum member and typically stay between 60 and 80 nights per year on the road.  This property was one of the worst Marriott properties I've stayed in.  The room was in poor repair (torn carpets, mold, caulking, chipped paint, dirt and grim in corners, hard water deposits, brown "stuff" in the bottom of the toilet, mis matched lights, rust, and food remnants in bottom of dishwasher and on the kitchen floor.  I had hoped that a property close to Disneyland would have been in fantastic shape - I was sorely mistaken.

Summary Heading: Warning...not all Marriotts are worth your $
Summary: I’ve lost all trust in being able to book at a Marriott and always getting a nice hotel. This hotel should definitely only be a 2 star hotel.  It started with check in & sketchy people hanging out around the door. My teenagers wouldn’t even stay in the car while I checked in.  We walked in to the hotel and all looked at each other when we noticed the smell.  We booked & payed for a two room king suite and got a queen (but they had no record of it). It basically looks like this hotel was built the same year as Disneyland and the only thing they’ve changed is the paint. The breakfast was fair, definitely did not live up to what their description says. We ate there once and then went out the other two mornings. It turned into a joke of how many crazy things we found with the

Other than that I would recommend this place to any of my friends or family members

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. When we checked in (don't remember her name but 1/8/18 evening shift) the clerk was extremely helpful and accommodating! Room was clean and comfortable, hotel quiet. Nice breakfast with good variety (eggs/sausage/yogurt/cereal/pastry/fruit/waffles). Coffee/tea/hot chocolate available any time. Used the very affordable ART shuttle to get to Disneyland. Was a little late a couple times but that's not the hotel's fault and pickup/dropoff is right at hotel entrance. About a 20-25 min ride to Disney and 15 min or so back. Drops you right at Disney entrance - shorter walk to park gates than using Disney parking. Made our Disney vacation great - would definitely stay here again!

Summary: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly beyond what you would normally expect.  I stay in hotels 200 nights a year and this staff was above 99.9% of them.  Room was well maintained, clean and comfortable.  I was in town for a Hockey Game and the Honda Center was less than 10 minutes away.  I thought it was walking distance but would have been a 20 minute walk so I drove.  They do have a shuttle for a fee that would drop you close but then I wasn't sure about the pick up wait so I elected to drive.  Nice stay and close to restaurants and grocery store

Summary: This hotel was fantastic.   The hotel is clean and organized.  The staff are very helpful, patient and know their jobs well.  I was on my own with my son and the staff recommended top places to visit, as well giving me suggestions in saving some money too. Mary-Angeles, Joy, Patrick, Adriana, Domi, Catalina, Ashley--- Oh boy I could go on!  Genuine people who treat you like you are part of a family.  I will always come back here again.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone.  We had a wonderful time here and the memories we made are precious.  There are not enough words to describe just how caring the people here at this hotel.  Please take my advice and come here- you will not be disappointed. Thank you

Summary: We had all together a nice visit here. Front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming, in fact, everybody we bumped into was pleasant to deal with. Check-in was quick even though it was a little more complicated on my end but they handled it gracefully. The room was clean and ready. It was nice having a full kitchen although we really didn't use too much of it. It was a little challenging with a two year old, trying to keep him out of the refrigerator and not turning on the stove, not climbing in the oven, Etc. Bed was comfy, I was a little alarmed when the shuttle train went whizzing by, thought that it would be difficult to sleep. But it's a commuter train so it doesn't run all night long and if it did we didn't hear it even though we faced the tracks. Lots of free parking

Summary: Arrived at the hotel late, check-in was quick and gentleman behind he desk was very accommodating. Needed extra sheets and blankets and got them without issue. The room itself was very clean although it did have a very musty smell, I chalked it up to being down the hall from the laundry room. Breakfast was great! The only issue I think that should be addressed is the pull out sofa bed, it was truly the worst I have ever slept on... The mattress would not lay flat so I woke up with a kink in my neck both nights.  Other than that, it was a nice place to stay. I will return for sure :)

Summary: I am a gold elite member with the Marriott brand. We stayed here earlier this month. I didn't have time to get around to making a complaint because we were getting things done for my mother in law's funeral. First off the first room we were given smelled like mildew. It was disgusting. So I went to the front desk and was given a second room next door to this room. It did not smell any better. So I was given a third room this time in the main building. So we move our things to this room. I brush my teeth and get into bed it was then 1:00am approximately. I lay on the right side of the bed and the bed breaks!! I am about 180 pounds why is the bed breaking? I fall out of the bed and hit my head on the corner of the night stand. At this point I am beyond furious. I calmly walk back

Summary: Hotel is perfectly situated for Angel's baseball games as it is within walking distance to the stadium. Free packing.  Staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Had a two bedroom suites, which was very comfortable.  Nice having a kitchenette, although we did not use it very much.  Nice options at breakfast although the eating area could be a little crowded.  Variety of eating options nearby.. Very good choice.

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff, walking distance to Angels Stadium
Summary: Very friendly staff at check-in. They gave us a few gifts at check in as we were Marriott rewards members (spin the wheel for points, a candy bar). We were just staying one night, as we wanted to go to an Angels game, and this was the perfect hotel.  We were able to walk to Angels stadium and the local breweries pretty easily. Parking was free and we didn't have to worry about parking at the stadium.   The room was a one bedroom place which was pretty spacious and there was a nice free breakfast.

Summary: More than perfect hotel for attending the Anaheim Angels Ball Game.  The stadium is within easy walking distance and offers free parking.  Exactly what I was looking for to avoid the mass confusion of paying to park and exit from the stadium.  The room was extremely upper scale and to my surprise, affordable in comparison to the other hotels in the area.  Clean, comfortable, delicious breakfast, accommodating staff.  Would recommend to all reading.

Summary: We stayed here for a weekend trip to Disneyland. The drive to Disney parking lot was easy--one exit down the highway, less than 10 mins in traffic. There is a Starbucks very close and the breakfast is good--the staff does a good job of keeping the stations full of food, the space is just not big enough to accomodate all of the people in there....its the most crowded breakfast spot I've ever seen in a hotel. The rooms are a bit run-down: carpet is looking a little worse for the wear, the furniture has chips in it, but for a stay with kids, none of that really matters. The rooms were a good size, and the hotel was quiet.

Summary: My husband and I recently stayed here for a Ducks playoff game.  It is within easy walking distance which was nice.  There were lots of people walking so safety was not a concern.  The lobby was decorated with Ducks decorations and there was free food and water/pop in the lobby,  Even though we cheer for the other team, it was a fun atmosphere!  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Our room was nice with an updated kitchen,  It was clean and well-stocked.  We only stayed for a weekend, but I would be comfortable to stay longer.  There are restaurants within walking distance.  We ate at Zov's across the street as recommended by the front desk staff.  Great food!  My only issue was breakfast.  The lobby is small and there were not enough tables for the people wanting breakfast.

Summary: I was visiting the area for business and picked this hotel for its proximity to my meetings.  I had some flight issues flying into California, so had to call and change my reservation.  When I called the hotel I spoke with Viri, who was super helpful and very friendly.  She took care of everything and had a great sense of humor.  When I checked in Viri happened to be working with a few others at the front desk.  They were all extremely friendly and welcoming.  The coffee in the lobby all day is a nice perk. I was unable to enjoy breakfast, but it looked nice as I grabbed an apple and ran out the door to meetings.  I will definitely be staying at this location if I have any future business in the Anaheim area. Management should be proud of their friendly, helpful, and smiling
Manager Response: none

Summary: We took our kids to Disneyland for the weekend (5,3 and 2) and stayed here. The first night we booked a 1-bedroom but got put in a studio in the main building that had a Queen bed and pull out bed. We immediately called down because this wasn't what we purchased.   They were super nice and even though they were full, they said they'd upgrade us and get us in a 2 bedroom for our second and last night there.  The first night we were in the main building with the lobby and our room had an adjoining door, even though we had a Studio. We heard our neighbors come in at 11pm and heard their TV through their door for awhile & the people above us were REALLY loud. The bed wasn't super cozy and we could feel the springs so we woke up kinda stiff.  Second night, we moved over to the other

Summary: Weekend stay, no complaints at all. It's located really close to the Honda civic center where I went for a concert, like minutes away. So is Downtown Disney and Disneyland so really, it's in a good off the main road location where you're close to everything but not the main traffic areas so to speak. Room was neat, spacious, full size fridge, stove, kitchen table etc which were appreciated. We arrived after midnight for check in and the gentleman at the front desk was very kind and friendly. We asked if there was a local Walgreens or something nearby for us to grab some last minute items and he walked to a mall they have laid out on one of their lobby walls. On it they had cards of nearby stores and other areas which was really neat and convenient (every hotel should have one).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, conveniently located, just a little noisy
Summary: We stayed here so that my daughter could attend a BTS concert (Korean pop band) at the Honda Center.    It it very conveniently located to the Honda Center, and within easy walking distance of it.  It was great not to have to worry about parking and driving in/around the Honda Center after a concert.  I was a little worried, since you have to walk under a big freeway overpass, which looked a little creepy, but clearly lots of people also stay at TownePlace Suites to attend concerts or events, because after the concert, we simply walked back to the hotel with a huge crowd of others, so it felt quite safe.  There are several places to eat right across the parking lot (Carl's Jr., Panda Express, TOGO's sandwich shop, a Mexican food place, Denny's, and Baskin-Robbins Ice Cream.  We
Manager Response: none

Summary: Like their complimentary Breakfast but the area is a bit small.  Upgraded us a bigger room.  Nice to have a kitchen.  less than 10 min. Drive to Disneyland.  not much noise overall we would like stay here again.

Summary: This hotel is an older building but it is well maintained. It is pretty clean, but not spotless like new. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The bathroom had a door between the sink and toilet/tub/shower, which is nice. We stayed in a suite with two bedrooms, a living/kitchen area, and the bathroom. The kitchen was well equipped and included a coffee maker, tiny microwave, stove/oven, dishwasher, frig. There were three tvs! The location is less than 2 miles from Disneyland. They do serve an adequate breakfast that tasted fine. The pool is heated. There are coin laundry machines. The gym has one bike, a treadmill, a tv, and maybe one other machine. The staff were young, and the kindest, most attentive hotel staff I've ever seen.   There is only one ice machine and it is at the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I book with Marriott because I expect a certain level of quality with the brand. This is by far the worst Marriott Brand hotel in Anaheim. The bathroom shower curtain is not waterproof and because the water pressure is so high water puddles all over the bathroom. Our phone rang once every few hours but you just hear a dial tone when you pick up. I reported the issue to the Front Desk but no one cared enough to do anything about it so we finally just disconnected the phone. This is the 4th Marriott we have tried in the Anaheim area and by far the worst. We are never coming back.

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff! Great rooms for the price
Summary: I prefer to stay at Marriott hotels if possible. This one didn't disappoint. It is what you would expect if you have stayed at Marriotts @ this price point. As always staff was very accommodating & friendly. They do serve breakfast which is always nice when you don't need to get moving & out the door in the am. The food is kept well & there is a variety. As for the lady that wrote about guests getting breakfast in their PJ'S. .. come on! Go to Dennys if you want a less laid back feeling over a buffet style of casual food eaten off paper plates. With regards to the comment about having the  "worst waffle he had ever tasted"... mine was delicious! So was my Coworkers! I know this because they thanked ME for making them.  Guests cook their own waffles so blame falls on your
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our experience at Townplace suites has been exceptional. The receptionist(Ashley) has been super helpful to us. The rooms are large enough when traveling with family for a Disney vacation.The breakfast spread is also good enough.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: High quality service with all conveniences at your footstep!
Summary: I stayed at Towneplace suites with my family for 2 months and couldn't have made a better choice for such an extended stay!  Front desk are just amazing! They made us feel like we're at home and helped us with everything we needed:) thanks Mary and everyone else for their friendliness and over and beyond helpfulness :) The kitchen option as well as the free breakfast made our stay much easier as we didn't have to rely on dining out for such a long stay! The mini market was a life saver for late night snacking! Free Coffee all day long definitely a plus! The neighborhood is very nice & safe with Starbucks,Panda Express and Denny's just a walking distance if you feel like grabbing a bite throughout the day..very close to Disneyland with a shuttle bus service to go there.  Free

Summary: Location is perfect for Angels games , only a few miles from Disney also, room was great , stove, fridge , dishwasher , large comfy bed . Lots of space ,  plenty of restaurants within walking distance . Polite and friendly staff

Summary: Staff was unreliable in giving info needed or helping with info upfront. Also after the first day, they never replaced water in their little store. There was alot of people staying there, many families going to Disneyland and no water to have after they came in or otherwise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here last minute because the hotel we normally stay at was booked because of a convention.  We thought the price was good and it wasn't too far so we tried it.  We wouldn't recommend it if you are going to Disney. They did have a shuttle that would take you to Disney but it was NOT reliable.  The front desk gave us a schedule that was not accurate.  Finally after waiting for an hour for the shuttle showed up.  We asked the driver about the times and he said the times the desk had were wrong.  We asked about the ones online he said those were not accurate either.   The hotel was clean and had exactly what we needed...Just the location was not ideal for visiting Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is really starting to show it's age, and should probably undergo some serious renovations if they want to keep their Marriott flag.  When I checked in I was greeted with a smile and recognized for my Marriott Rewards status.  I was also given the option to spin a wheel for a "free prize".  Initially I landed on a free beverage.  The gal at the desk said "You don't want that, spin again".  On the next spin I won 3,000 bonus points, so that was nice!  Unfortunately this is where the positives end.  We got to our room which was old and dingy.  It had a musty smell to it and everything just seemed really out of date.  We were only staying one night and it was pretty late when we checked in or we probably would have found other accommodations for remaining nights.    The
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a good stay towneplace suite Anaheim.  Booked 2 rooms with kids.  Breakfast is good but the area is a bit small.  More chairs and tables will be great.  It was crowded.  Overall. We enjoy our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Orange County Brew and Music Festival
Summary: my wife and I wanted a room close to the City National Grove of Anaheim for a brew and music festival. We were very impressed with the room and location of the hotel. It is walking distance to the Grove and to Anaheim Stadium with many different types of food places around. The room we stayed in had a full refrigerator and kitchen. If you are staying for a few days to see Disneyland or any of the other attractions in the area it is centrally located, clean and has a decent breakfast. Overall very impressed. front desk staff was very energetic and appears to really enjoy working there. I even saw them deliver a playpen to one room for a small child.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We checked in at 2am to a ground floor room. When we opened the door the room smelled a little musty, but once we turned on the A/C the smell seemed to dissipate. The rooms are simple and functional with nice little kitchens. Handy for anyone staying long term with a stove, oven, microwave, and large fridge. The bed was a queen and very comfortable and the room had a sofa bed too. The washrooms had great water pressure and very hot water even during a sold out weekend. Overall the rooms are a little tired or dated as are the hallways of the hotel.  The breakfast area in the front lobby is cramped at breakfast time and it's to bad they don't  have a separate room to have this in or more seating outside. The selection is pretty simple with the waffles, toast, juice, milk, coffee
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been to many Resident Inns and this place is similar but not quite the same as it's showing it's age. The studio I was in had a kitchen so the room setup is similar to a Resident Inn. Checkin was fine but forget the Marriott nonsense about just pick up your key if you checkin with their app. No key till they swipe your credit card. No mention of platinum status which we are.   Room looks fine but heavily scented which maybe due to previous pets in the room. Hallways are dreary especially the second building.   Location is good for fast food as Carl's Junior and McDonalds are close and Denny's is next door. Across the freeway from Disneyland but close to Angel's stadium.   All in all, just a place to put your head down. Price was low but nothing exceptional here. Just a simple
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for seven days and six nights, which gave us an extended experience of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and always had answers to any questions we had.  As a family we stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, and it was great! The beds were comfy, and our room would be cleaned before we got back from our trips during the day.  The hotel has a shuttle that runs to Disneyland for only small fee, and there are no lack of fast food or restaurants nearby.  The elevator was a bit small, and there was only one to service the entire hotel, so we took the stairs more often than not. The main lobby is also a bit small, so the breakfast buffet is better eaten in your room rather than downstairs.  Other than that, it was a great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Arisa,   Thank you for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. As a valued guest, your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   Thank you for staying at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Anaheim.   Sincerely,

Summary: Great place nice pool, lovely guest service. Everything we asked they did for us. The pool is very good and we can make barbecues while staying there, and they borrow the seasonings. We have to deal with late deliveries from Amazon and they helped us. Surely I will stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Cynizuter,   Thank you for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. As a valued guest, your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   Thank you for staying at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: the hotel is old but has many advantages. it is near disnyland and the suit was very clean with full kitchen the beds was comfortable. the breakfast is good and fresh and every afternoon they put cokies such as the hot drinks was available all the day. the staff was friliendly and helpful. I was very nice stay for our family.
Manager Response: Dear Nooraamm,   Thank you for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. As a valued guest, your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   Thank you for staying at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: When we checked in I asked the lady do you sell Disney tickets.  She said no we don't you have to get them from other businesses in the area.  I thought this comment was odd because they have a computer to buy them in the lobby and have posted about them all over.  The sleep and room was excellent.  Breakfast was excellent.  We asked if there was a shuttle to Disney and they told us yes, and told us that it would cost for our family around $16 for a round trip.  We asked if we had to buy tickets for the shuttle and she said not you pay for it on the shuttle.  We got on the shuttle and it was $12 since we didn't buy tickets from the hotel.  Unfortunately the hotel, didn't offer us to buy the tickets for Disney or for the shuttle.  We ended up ubering back to the hotel for $7.
Manager Response: Dear Stacy,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium.    As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: After traveling all day from Florida we arrived 4 hours earlier than check in. Telling the staff we were exhausted they had our room cleaned and we were able to take a nap before going to an Angels game, which by the way is within walking distance. Great Staff !
Manager Response: Dear Bobby,   Thank you for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. As a valued guest, your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   Thank you for staying at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: We had been in the area for a convention and rather than fight the Friday afternoon LA traffic we decided to spend another night and take in an Angels' game.  We found this place on the web and it turned out to be ideal.  It was easy to get to and although it doesn't have a restaurant there is a Denny's right across the street, and other choices within walking distance.  It is also within walking distance to Angels' Stadium and the lady at check in gave us good directions on how to cut through the parking lot across the street and save a few steps. The property is clean and the rooms are comfortable and the WIFI worked good.  It certainly served our purpose and was just a couple of blocks from where we could get back on the freeway and head home the next morning.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm surprised this is a Marriott property!!! It's old...needs a remodel, a/c made strange noises all night, small rooms, very cheap furnishings, & sofa pull out beds are very uncomfortable.  Definitely would not stay here again. On a positive note...it's inexpensive, rooms have a kitchen, & a short walk to Angel Stadium
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding our hotel. We appreciate you bringing these items to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Best regards,

Summary: Great location for going to an Angels game.  Five-minute walk to the stadium, and a little longer to Stub Hub to pick up our tickets.  Hotel itself is clean, standard rooms.  Staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your wonderful 5 star review.  Please come see us again on your next Angels game.  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: Nice place to stay. Close enough Vidcon that I bought shuttle passes for kids so they can go to event without me driving. Staff very helpful told a place to eat and was good. Breakfast normal for a Marriott but it was included with price of room. Most people took their breakfast back to room. Not plenty places to sit and eat but during our stay we were always able to find table to eat. Oatmeal was better than o th her places and I also liked that they kept the coffee on the whole day. Rooms could have been bigger but it had a small kitchen which works great to save money. Parking was free which was another great perk. No real complaints. We will stay again here if it available. Great value for the money.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your wonderful review.  I look forward in welcoming you back on your next trip to Anaheim.  Hospitably,   Greg Williams

Summary: I would say it helps to be a member of Marriott program (free to join); our bathroom was very small but the bed & all other was very good.  Great night rest.  The staff and all other were very nice and helpful in making your stay worth it.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review and wonderful comments towards the staff.  I look forward in welcoming you back to the TownePlace Suites Anaheim.  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: You still have to drive to Disneyland from this hotel but it's really close. We had two bedrooms and a one bathroom room. The rooms had a fridge stove coffee maker microwave dishwasher and dishes. It's a great place to stay long term and want to save money on food.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  I hope to see you at the TownePlace Suites on your next trip to Anaheim.  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: The customer service my wife and I experienced was the best we've ever had. When the local ART shuttle failed to arrive on time to take us to Disneyland, the manager, Carol, took us personally to Disneyland in her car. Brittany, another staff member left a basket of goodies in our room as an apology for the inconvenience, and it wasn't even their fault that the shuttle didn't arrive. The staff were all so friendly and helpful. I couldn't recommend them more highly! We'll definitely be back at TownePlace Suites Anaheim next time we come to Disneyland. - Rob Packer, Tauranga, New Zealand
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review.  You were an absolute pleasure to have as a guest and look forward in welcoming you back to the TownePlace Suites when you come back state side.  I hope the flight wasn't too long back to New Zealand!  Hospitably,   Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: This is a nice place few minutes away from the Disneyland park. I like this location as it is in the middle of all happening places in Anaheim. The suites are good, little under equipped in their fully equipped kitchen as they promote. However, extra utensils were easily arranged with the front desk. Friendly people.  Visiting Disneyland this place is ok. Since you only come to sleep so you don't really care for the hotel and its amenities.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review.  I am glad to see that we were able to take care of your needs for the most part, but please feel free to reach out to me personally to discuss your stay in more detail so we can learn how to turn your three star review into a five.  Thank you again and I hope to see you on your next visit to Anaheim.  Hospitably,   Greg Williams General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing customer service throughout the hotel
Summary: Was there recently on a college tour visit for my son.  Not high expectations for the facility as it was a quick stay and really did not expect much in terms of the hotel.  What stood out was the fantastic service by all we encountered at the hotel.  From the front desk to the maid service and the on-duty manager.  All were very helpful and courteous.  The room they gave us was huge (an upgrade due to Platinum status) - it was a 2 bedroom which really helped as a family of four.
Manager Response: Dear David,   Thank you for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  As a valued guest and Platinum Elite member, we appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations and being able to give that upgrade is just a small token of our appreciation.  Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!   Sincerely, Eddie Navarro eddie.navarro@marriott.com

Summary: A staff as accommodating as this is a rare find. I had some trouble locating a cart as we were staying in for several days. So I stuck my head in the closest office to where the carts should be, interrupting Carol, although she didn't act like it was an interruption at all. She looked herself then enlisted the help of others and a cart was found for me quickly.     Fully loaded I was pulling the cart from my car into the hotel and Greg came to my side, He took over the cart and escorted me all the way to our room.  Later I found out he was the assistant manager, I was impressed that he would do that for me instead of finding an "underling".     Once I got everything in the room I kicked off my shoes and got things put away. Later I realized I had left on my white socks and
Manager Response: Dear Linda,   Thank you for so much for sharing your experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium through the Guest Satisfaction Survey.  As a valued guest, we appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations and it seems that Teresa and her staff did just that! I will be sure to post this review for all our staff to see. By the way, Greg is actually our General Manager!! It's his leadership that drives us to go above and beyond!  Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!   Sincerely, Eddie Navarro eddie.navarro@marriott.com

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay, Yummy Breakfast But Occasional Bad Traffic Jam
Summary: I've always enjoyed my stay at this hotel chain and have been a loyal customer for the past 15 years. The hotel on State College Boulevard has been our family's hotel of choice because of its convenient location.   For this trip, I was traveling alone and I was pleasantly surprise. The two ladies who welcomed me with such warm smiles that I immediately felt right at home.  The place was well-kept, clean and comfortable and I loved the small kitchen that came with the room. Perfect set-up for my 2-week stay. Free Wifi was quite reliable but a bit slow. Unless you are prepared to pay for the faster connection.  Morning breakfast was a big spread. Certainly enough to load up for a good morning. However, the coffee runs out fast, so must be quick.  Parking, laundry and check out
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review.  I am glad to see that you enjoyed your stay.  On you next visit, feel free to see the front desk for best escape routes out of the hotel to by pass the game day traffic.  Hospitably,   Greg Williams General Manager

Summary Heading: Looking for hotel walking distance to Angel  Stadium.
Summary: Price was right, room clean, roomy and had everything you need.  Walking distance to Angel Stadium and restaurant  Free wi fi, parking and breakfast. Was Greeted with chocolate chip cookies right out of the oven. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Was looking at another hotel down the road, was more expensive and charged $10.00 for parking. So glad I decided on this hotel and I would definitely come back.
Manager Response: Dear Happy90,  Thank you for your Five Star Review and for selecting the TownePlace Suites Anaheim. I am very pleased that your enjoyed your stay. Again thank you for your kind and gracious comments about our team. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Kind Regards, Greg Williams

Summary: The Marriott TownePlace Suites is right across the street from Disneyland... Just a hop and skip to the happiest place on earth. The front desk clerk named Heather was so friendly and upgraded us to a themed room on the 8th floor so we could see the fireworks at night and my grandson could enjoy Captain Jack Sparrow pictures all over the wall. Every time we came and left from the hotel we were greeted by a friendly Marriott staff employee. Pizza Hut and an arcade on the third floor were so convenient. We enjoyed dinner and breakfast there and my grandson love playing all the games. We even had time for a swim in the pool. I would highly recommend this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland along with the super friendly staff making us feel welcome there
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, however, I believe you have us confused with our sister property, the Residence Inn by Marriott.  I will look to see if Trip Advisor will be able to move this over to their page so they can see all the wonderful comments you had to say about their property.  Feel free to visit us during your next Anaheim Trip however!   Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice property. But some noise issues
Summary: Overall this two building property is kept up very nicely. There is free parking. And free breakfast. The property is a little on the older side. But it's kept up well and maintained nicely. The rooms were comfy, the mattress was alright. Could have been better. And the rooms were spacious and clean. My room had a connecting door,  not sure if all of the rooms are like that. But it's not sealed very well and I could hear next door quite clearly. Also the rooms towards the back of the hotel building B and some of the ones of building A face the train which goes by fairly frequently. So if that bothers you probably take up room on the other side. It's very convenient to restaurants, the convention center, the stadium and even Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review.  I am glad to see that overall you enjoyed your stay.  Next time in town, please give us a call and we will make sure that you will not have a connecting room.  Hope to see you soon.  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: Excellent staff-really want to make sure your visit is good. Manager Eddie was always available for questions and assistance.  Beds are comfortable, swimming pool has tables with umbrellas and a new gas barbecue that is available to guests.   Beds are comfortable.  Kitchen equipment was well stocked. Air conditioning is adequate but noisy.  Cute touches in the room included swans made out of bath towels. Breakfast is the standard Townplace suites but very limited seating.   Would recommend additional toasters and waffle maker to support the number of people trying to eat.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you so much for your wonderful review as well as your kind words for Eddie and the rest of our staff! I will be sure to share your comments along to them. Thank you again and I look forward in welcoming you back. Hospitably, Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: We booked two 2-bedroom suites for a family reunion and Disney trip. From check in to check out the staff was friendly and helpful and even gave the little ones cookies every time we passed the front desk. The rooms are modern, clean and very comfortable. We will definitely come back the next time we come to Anaheim!
Manager Response: Dear Cecelia,  Thank you for your wonderful review. I am so glad to hear that you had a great stay.   I look forward in welcoming you back to the TownePlace Suites on your next visit to Anaheim!  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel for a Family trip to Disney
Summary: Very nice Towne Place hotel. It's very well located in next to a small group of restaurants and a near drive to disney. The hotel has all the necessary services and the personell was perfect at all times. Breakfast is the normal small Towne Suites type that you'll find in all the hotels of this brand. It's small but has all what you need to start your day. The Hotel has free parking which is a plus.
Manager Response: Dear Marcos C,  Thank you for your wonderful review. I am glad to see that you were able to have an enjoyable stay with us. I hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim!  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary: The rooms were very spacious and clean however, very noisy being on the second floor.  Kids jumping and running all hours of day and night.  Front staff were very helpful and the breakfast was great. Shuttle (ART pay as you go or get a pass at the office) was just outside the door as was Denny's and Starbucks. Not the usual Mariott standard though.  Older- small pool. --Hence the 3 star.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that we did not live up to your expectations. Please feel free to contact me personally to discuss your stay in more detail so I know how we can turn your three into a five.  Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager Greg.Williams@Marriott.com 714-939-9700

Summary: We loved our stay of 2 weeks here...it is close to everything we walked to Disneyland every day which is 45 minutes each way..the ducks stadium and Angels stadium and Amtrak train were 20 minutes walk also,there were plenty of food options in the area.My husband is on overseas deployment and this is where we agreed to stay for his 2 week break  our daughte who is 11 and i flew over to meet him and the staff at this hotel are outstanding...Joy from the front desk is an absolute gem..she organized a shuttle for my daughter and I to go back to the airport to greet hubby (we arrived on earlier flight) upon our arrivel back ee had a beautiful bowl of goodies and welcome home balloons and vouchers for dinner nothing was ever to much trouble and then when it was time for hubby to leave
Manager Response: Dear Karen,  Thank you so much for your amazing five star review as well as your wonderful comments towards Joy and Rosa.  I will be sure to pass along your great comments to her and the rest of the team.   Thank you again,  and we hope to see you back again.   Hospitably,  Greg Williams General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a bad location from Disneyland Resort
