Two insider tips (1) If you are on the 4th floor in the back of the building on the State College side, you can see the Disney fireworks from your window. On the 4th of July, we were able to see the LA Angels fireworks from one side and the Disney fireworks from the other side of the parking lot. (2) TPS is 1.5 miles from The Outlets at Orange. Just take State College south and it becomes The City Drive South. The mall is on your right. Besides hot Krispy Kreme Donuts, there are restaurants, a theater, and plenty of high-end
Manager Response: Dear Kenritak,  Thank you so much for taking the time to complete our survey about the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Marriott! With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations. As a valued customer, your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service.   We look forward to serving you again in the future! Warmest Regards, Adam Sahagun

Summary: We picked the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim based on reviews we'd read, as well as its proximity to the Grove of Anaheim.  The registration desk staff were very pleasant and helpful.  We were able to get our room slightly before the 3pm check-in time. Our suite was spacious and clean, with a queen size bed.  Surprised at the full kitchen including pots, dishes, glassware, etc.  A family with small children would find this a great place to stay, and could save a fortune on a Disneyland visit with being able to have some meals in their own room.  We were walking distance from The Grove, as well as a great restaurant (The Chart) just a few blocks away. In fact we were so close, that we were able to bring leftovers from the restaurant back to the refrigerator in our room, and still
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not what you would expect from a category 5 hotel
Summary: We stayed here for one night only and this is what we found good & not so good. Not so good: - Room (1 BDR suite) small - Mattress in pull-out couch was old, stained (we called and they replaced for another old but not stained). Mattress was lumpy. Hard to sleep on that "additional" bed. I would consider this room sleeps only 2. - Breakfast area located next to reception and small. Good: - Internet worked fine - Room was clean. - Shower worked. Tons of hot water for nice shower after long day - Parking free. Near Disneyland, Angels stadium - Breakfast saturday morning included a couple of waffle machines, bagels, english muffins, juices, milk, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fuit, yogurt. It was crowded but maybe it just seemed like that because it was a small area. Not sure. Food was
Manager Response: Hi Marissa,  First, I wanted to thank you for your feedback. Second, I would like apologize for the not so good experience you had at our hotel. We really do try and strive for the outstanding, and obviously we failed you during your stay.  We do have some plans in the future to expand our breakfast area, because, it is a tad bit small. I have made my staff aware of the issues you encountered during your stay, and we have plans in place now to avoid this in the future with the rest of our guests.  I hope this experience doesn't prohibit you from traveling to us in the future. Please reach out to me if your in the area again. I will make sure we take care of you.  Have a great day!

Summary: Dani Johnson the front office manager greeted me with a warm hello and a beautiful smile. She answered all of my questions .  Breakfast is served in the lobby dining area. It consist of hot waffles,oatmeal and a variety of cold cereal and muffins and breads. The staff works hard to keep it well supplied and the dining area clean. They are all very friendly!!  You have a problem in your room and call the front desk and they will send someone right away, the two I met were Wayne and Jose and they were friendly and concerned to solve my minor problems right away .  Parking is free and lots of it. The lot and grounds are kept up.  There is a laundry room , gym and a nice pool area.  There are restaurants and fast food  within walking distance.  I would recommend this place to anyone
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location, Well, Kept, Nice Staff
Summary: We visited Disneyland last week and stayed at this hotel.  It offered a two-bedroom suite with a small kitchen about 10 minutes from the park.  It is almost directly across the street from the baseball stadium (easy walking distance).  There is a strip-center with a couple of quick restaurants but not much in the direct vicinity.  The staff was very friendly and the free breakfast was well-stocked.  The hotel was nicely maintained and in pretty good shape.  They do have a shuttle to the park but we drove every day.  Nice place for a decent price.
Manager Response: NJJimbob13,  Thank you for your kind words. We are very glad you enjoyed yourself while in Anaheim. Hope to see you soon!  Adam Sahagun General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice front desk, ok facilities, convenient to everything!
Summary: I usually don't stay at efficient type hotels (the ones with kitchenettes) but we were going to a concert that was less than a mile from the hotel and I hate dealing with event parking more...so we booked here.  The front desk was quite nice and wasn't rattled or offended when I asked for an upgrade.  Of course, being near Disneyland, Anaheim Stadium and the Honda Center it was near impossible to get an upgrade, and I didn't get it, but she handled it well. Hotel room itself was ok.  Clean, but the furniture...egads it comes right out of those Aaron rental facilities.  Particleboard based furniture everywhere.  But for one night, a clean room, and surprisingly quiet and most importantly convenience to the Honda Center.  And I will send a shout out to Joy who checked us in, and
Manager Response: Inluvwithjapan,  I wanted to say thank you for the review. While we strive to accommodate all of our guests requests, I apologize a upgrade was not available. Please let us know when you coming back into the area, and we will try and do our best to give you that upgrade.   Thanks,  Adam Sahagun General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed at this Marriott location for our family trip to Disneyland; figured the extra room you get when staying at a TPS would be needed after long days at the park. The hotel is in a good location with a few restaurants and a Starbucks within walking distance. You can tell the hotel is a bit old, but the grounds, lobby, and room were very clean. I've stayed in a lot of TPS locations and this was by far the cleanest room I've stayed in. The staff was extremely friendly, house keeping was fantastic, and Daniela was amazing. Daniela went far and above each morning to attend to our needs (without request) during breakfast and was extremely friendly the entire time; she's an allstar for Marriott! The breakfast choices could have been better, but included waffles,
Manager Response: MPearce03,  Thank you for your review! We are very pleased you and your family enjoyed your time at our hotel. Daniela will be very excited to hear about your comments regarding her service.  Hope to see you soon!   Adam Sahagun General Manager

Summary: I found this whole place to be a night mare. from advertising a Gym that has since shut down on the website to fast and free Wi Fi which did not work. The over all customer service on the front desk was appauling. The only saving grace was that the house keeping ladies were great and kept the place spotless. Taking holding deposits on top of holding deposits for which we were not informed although we expected it.
Manager Response: Hello Adam,  I'm sorry that you had this experience. In regards to your experience here at our hotel, I was wondering if it might be possible that you might have mistaken our hotel for another. You mentioned that our gym has since been shut down. However, our gym has never been shut down, and we also have two gyms located at our property to help accomadate our guests needs.   We also have recently completed a extensive internet upgrade. Which consisted of all new hardware, software and even access points to ensure connectivity to all of our guests. We even have double download and upload speeds for a small nominal fee for the guests who like to either stream video/music or just surf at a faster pace.   I truly am sorry for the experience, but if you wouldn't mind contacting us so we may resolve this issue, we would greatly appricate the oppurtunity to make it right.   Look forward to speaking with you soon!  Adam Sahagun  General Manager 714-939-9700

Summary: My family and I stayed in this hotel for a visit to Disneyland and other L.A. attractions. We rented the 2 bedroom suite so everyone had room after long days out and about. The room itself was very comfortable and had its own kitchen so that we didn't have to always eat expensively. The hotel staff was generally friendly and helpful. Breakfast here is average for hotel continental breakfast but I suggest going early as their breakfast area is small and can get quite crowded. The only disappointment I had was that our room was not serviced by the cleaning staff during the last 2 days of our stay despite the fact that we are out and about for many hours on each day so that they had time to do it. We were so tired by the time we got back from our daily activities that we didn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at this property for 3 nights and had a fabulous stay!  The location is just a few miles south of the Orange County/Los Angeles County line.  You could not ask for a better location all around!  The hotel is about a half mile off of I-5 and is right across the street from Angels Stadium.  One night we walked from our room to the stadium and made it there in a couple of minutes.  I was a bit nervous that traffic might be bad around game time as fans are coming in but I was surprised to see no traffic at all.  Disneyland is located about 1-2 miles away.  The staff was nice enough to tell us a shorter way over to Disney and we were in the parking lot in under 5 minutes.  The staff is top notch!  I have never met a more friendly staff.  All of the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is terrific for Angels games and the Mouse Land stuff.  In fact, my biggest fear staying here was that it would be overrun with hyper little mousketeers.  If they were here, they were quiet.  The hotel is scrupulously clean, the staff is very helpful and just plain nice.  Our room was a great size - we were on a work trip and having that oversize desk with more outlets than I can think of devices to plug into them was terrific.  The pool and spa were in use, but not overcrowded.  The wi fi is free and fast. We had to leave before the breakfast is available at 6:30am, but there is a Denny's very close if you are in the same situation and need your breakfast first.  I'd go there again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: In town for an Angels game, could not have been better.
Summary: We stayed one night in Anaheim and this property was perfect.  Free parking and an easy walk to Angel Stadium.  Eating/drinking options for everyone within walking distance.  If we were staying longer we certainly would have used the full kitchen.  The beds were comfortable and the showering was perfect.  The free breakfast hit the spot.  I have a soft spot for a free breakfast with waffles.  The pool was clean and the hot tub was warm.  Overall a fantastic experience.  If I ever find myself back in Anaheim I will certainly stay at TPSA.  We took a quick drive over to Downtown Disney after we checked out.  Don't hesitate about staying here.  Well worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my favorite hotel when coming to town to see the Angels. It's located a block away from the stadium, making for an easy walk while others are dealing with pregame and postgame traffic.  It's a family friendly residence inn with a nicely equipped kitchen including a full oven, not just a stovetop. It has all the pots and pans you'll need and full place settings.  It's not a luxury hotel by any means but it's clean and comfortable, and the staff is excellent. They're always friendly and helpful.  The hotel is also a short distance from Disneyland. Not so close that you're paying through the nose, but a very short shuttle bus ride away. There is a small charge for the shuttle. You catch it right outside the office.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked 2 rooms for a trip to Disneyland and the experience was not what I have come to expect from Marriott properties. I won't get into all the details, but there were both service and cleanliness issues.  The issues were substantial enough for a conversation with management and it sounds as if major changes are in progress and management did a really nice job of rectifying the situation. Given that changes are in the works, I would give this property another shot, as the location is really solid.
Manager Response: Mr. Whiskeyman,  We appreciate your feedback. having said that, rest assured that its our goal to provide not only top tier customer service, but also clean and comfortable rooms that are not only to our standards, but to you.. our guest.  We are well on our way! As you know we are going to quite a bit of change, a needed change to enhance our customer service and ensure that all of our guests leave feeling confident that the next time they are in Anaheim, they will be coming back to our hotel.   Please reach out to me if there is anything else I can do for you!   Have a great day!   -Adam Sahagun

Summary Heading: Typical Townplace a bit run down
Summary: Nothing special. Easy to get on and off freeway. The hotel is a bit worn. Smallish pool. Fine for a few nights stay. Reasonable clean. not spotless. The front desk staff are vey helpful and friendly. The rooms are a bit musty smelling. Lots of families with kids. The hotel is quiet during the day and gets more lively after about 5, when families are tired and needing a rest from the parks. Free parking. The rate at the full service Marriot Convention Center was close to the same, but the parking is $24 per day there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium. I apologize that your recent stay was not satisfactory and appreciate your feedback.    You’re a valued customer; everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience. Please be assured that we are taking immediate corrective steps to avoid such problems in the future.    If you would like to discuss your experience further, please feel free to contact me directly at the phone number listed below. Once again, please accept my apology. We would like to regain your trust and we hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to this area.    Sincerely,  Adam Sahagun  General Manager  Towneplace Suites Anaheim Maingate  GMTPSA@T4shotels.com  714-939-9700

Summary: You can certainly do a lot worse in this area, can you do better I'm not sure.    First, the pros: * It was $159/night for a 1 bedroom suite, which is cheaper than many hotels in the area. * Free breakfast * Free parking * Location is great, close to Disney and Angels stadium * Shuttle to Disney is cheap, $5/person, $2/kid round trip. * Suites are comfortable. * The coffee is very good, nice and dark.  Next, the cons: * Room smelled like some cleaner that I couldn't identify.  I don't know if the smell was to cover something else. * The line for the two waffle makers was ridiculous.  We waited over 30 minutes to make a waffle. * The seating area for breakfast is very small.   * There are no meats/eggs for breakfast.  This is unusual for a TownePlace.  I need some protein in the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our Guest Satisfaction Survey and sharing your experience with the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate Near Angel Stadium.   You indicated in your response that your stay was unsatisfactory. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience you may have experienced. We take great pride in ensuring our guest’s satisfaction. Unfortunately, we did not meet your—or our own—expectations. Our goal is to address your concerns so that we can ensure you have an exceptional experience on your next visit.  Sincerely,  Adam Sahagun General Manager TownePlace Suites Anaheim adam.sahagun@marriott.com 714-939-9700

Summary: They like me sooo much at this hotel that they gave me a studio suite that had a flat screen tv, fully functioning fully equipped kitchen, comfortable bed, and a desk to do my work at. And in the morning they treated my to a nice continental type breakfast featuring cook your own hot waffles.  Kidding aside, they like everyone and they do this for all guest. And guest love this hotel. While I was here I meet business executives and families vacationing in the Disneyland area.  This hotel seemed to attract upper-middleclass type of client, as it is perfect for either long term or overnite stays.  There are about are 7 or 8 restaurants within walking distance including a Starbucks and Denny's and a mini-market located in the gas station across the street.  Angels Baseball Stadium
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your great review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your time in Anaheim and at our hotel. Thank you again for staying and we look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: TownePlace Suites Anaheim is good if you are: a) traveling with kids; b) traveling with a team; c) are ok with a 3-star (at best) hotel. I give it 2.5 stars out of 5 stars. Located directly across Angel Stadium. It comes with a mini stove/oven, full sink, dishwasher, toaster, microwave, and refrigerator/freezer. Dinnerware/utensils for 4 people, pots/pans, 2 kitchen towels, 2 potholders, travel size dishwashing liquid (no sponge/pads), and one roll of paper towels are provided. I had a studio room with one queen and one sofa bed, which will comfortably accommodate 2 parents and 2 children under age 12.  There is a Panda Express, Starbucks, Denny’s, Ice Cream shop, McDonalds, and Carl’s Jr. directly across the hotel and a few family restaurants within walking distance. It is a
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I apologize if you had issues during your stay as our primary goal is make sure our guests experience is a positive one. I'm sorry you didn't get service during the time frame you would have liked. If I may suggest next time you stay with us. Please inform the front desk when a convenient time during your stay housekeeping can enter your room and we would be happy to honor that. Currently our housekeeper work from 9am to 530pm. Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: Good value and location.  It's walking distance to Angels Stadium and some eateries.  Our family enjoyed the complimentary cookies, fruit and water upon check in.  That was a nice touch.  The breakfast is decent.  There was only one waffle maker, so I had to wait in line for almost 1/2 hr to make a waffle.  I would suggest taking a toaster off the counter and replacing it with another waffle maker.  There were (2) 4 slice toasters. I observed only two slots being used at a time, whereas there was a line 15 deep at times of people waiting to make waffles.  The parking spaces are tight too.  Overall...a good stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words on trip advisor about our location I am happy to hear you enjoyed your time at our hotel and Anaheim. Thank you for the bring to my attention the breakfast issue you had and I will personally look into a second waffle making station. Thank you again for staying and we look forward to next arrival.

Summary: Booked a two bedroom suite for 5 nights. Spacious, and most all in working order minus the master bedroom door and tv....both of which had issues. Staff was attentive and responsive to all concerns. Laundry facilities were not the greatest, recommend taking your clothes to the nearby laundromat if you do not wish to sit around for two hours for two loads. They have a Disneyland shuttle stop via ART that is great...$5 per person. My only complaint would be the price, I thought it too high but then again, welcome to So. Cal.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your time in Anaheim. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us. Thank you for bringing the laundry facilities to our attention. We have currently purchased several new washers and dryers that are arriving soon to replace some of the older units with have on site. We look forward to your next arrival with us and thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: My family of 5 stayed at the hotel for three nights in March. It was a good location if you are going to the ball game or hockey game. The free continental breakfast was basic and generally fine except that the juice machine was out of order and they had no alternatives. The first day there were small cans of apple juice, but the next two mornings there was nothing. Why couldn't the hotel have purchased juice and placed them in pitchers to refill or purchase more small cans of juice?  The breakfast items were not re-stocked regularly even though there was someone in the area working.  Upon check-out we found out that our young children had ended up going to a pay channel and we were charged for a movie that they did not know they were paying for (they just click the buttons) and
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Trip Advisor. It is unfortunate that we did not meet your expectations. Our goal is to make sure that our guests are aware of the type of amenities that we offer. Our Continental breakfast offers several items from six types of cereals, muffins, bagels & English muffins, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, a waffle station, and juice. We apologize that during your time with us we had an issue that was out of our control and the preventative maintenance service on our equipment failed due to an internal part malfunction. This issue has been corrected and we now have a new juice machine which was replaced quickly after this time frame. For future guest arriving with small children you can request to have all movies turned off in your suite to avoid this issue as movies watched past a certain amount of time cannot be removed. Just ask a friendly front desk agent at your time of check in and they will be happy to adhere to this request. We did try and assist you in removing as many of the movie items as we could. Thank you again for staying with us and we would love another opportunity to improve upon your last visit. Thank you for again for staying.

Summary: I ended up getting this room for free so my review may be biased.  Room was clean and modern. We had the one bedroom suite. Room was spacious, and the kitchenette complete. However, none of the doors locked. Annoying with kids! Pool was nice.   Breakfast was a little weak. Overall a good experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor. I am glad to hear that you had a great experience at our hotel. We enjoy enhancing the guest stay in the Anaheim area. We look forward to your next arrival with us and another shared experience. Till next time.  -TownePlace Suites

Summary: Stayed here for one night on a reward certificate. Everything went well. Parking was a little bit crowded, and the parking spaces are very close together causing some larger vehicles to do over the line. That made some spaces unavailable. But there is plenty of handicap parking if you need that. I usually visit Disneyland when I am in the area and it's just a short drive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay and reviewing us on Trip Advisor. As you stated we are just a hop, skip, and a jump away from the Disneyland Resort and on our busy nights our parking lot does get full however we always have parking for our guests. Thank you so much for stay with us and we look forward to assisting you in the future.

Summary: We stayed here in late May for a Disney land and LA area trip.  Breakfast was good.  I got tickets from the front desk instead of going to Disney for them.  Their price was $50 better for what the disney site quoted me.  The park shuttle stops here right out side the front desk entrance (but we did not use that so I can't comment on that).  There was one issue - the elevator was spotty.  Would work then got stuck again.  On the first floor you have to push pretty hard to get it to come down.  Not a huge issue for me, they did get it fixed.  The property does not ignore issues that I can tell.  I stayed in a 1 bedroom on the top floor - nice new counters in kitchen and bath.  Everything was clean, fold out worked well for my kids.  The furniture looks very nice as well, looked
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor. I hope you enjoyed your time in the Anaheim area and at the Disneyland resort. We apologize for the issue with the elevator buttons. This issue has been corrected and the buttons have been replaced to make it easier for guest use. We look forward to your next arrival and thank you for staying.

Summary: This hotel was nice enough for the reasonable prices.  It was within (25 minute) walking distance from Disneyland and 2 minutes from Anaheim Stadium.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  We would stay here again if we return.
Manager Response: Thank you for review on trip advisor. We are glad you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next arrival.

Summary Heading: Still, not the best Marriott in the chain
Summary: I am a die hard Marriott fan. This is one of my least favorite Marriotts. I stayed here a little over a year ago for work. I had to stay here again last week. They had updated the lobby, and I heard they updated the rooms. The decor was nice but the fit and finish still leaves a lot to be desired. there was pink mildew on the baseboards because they didn't wrap them all the way.  The room layout is VERY awkward, you can't really easily turn the TV so that you can view it from bed because of the placement and the length of the cables.   I also found the bed to be very flat and not cushy at all, like other Marriott beds.  My coworker found a giant bin of trash in the hall when he got off the elevator at 11PM, not like it was left in the midst of cleaning, just left.  At least this
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor we have completed our renovation of our lobby and suites. It is unfortunate that they did not meet your standards. As a select service Marriott hotel we try and provide our guests with the best experience possible in our budget branded style of hotel. As my entire team works 24/7 to provide all our guest with an exceptional experience we must work for the duration of that time and continue to strive to find ways to make sure that we do not hinder our guests stay. It is unfortunate that we again did not meet your expectations but will look forward to your next arrival and your continue patronage.

Summary: Lots of Marriott's I looked at and stayed at before will charge your for parking. I was lucky enough to find this place that included parking with the cost of the room. Nice. I think parking should always be included with your hotel. But that's just me.  Anyways I actually used reward points to book one night here at TownePlace Suites in between a two day visit at Disneyland. It's actually pretty close to Disneyland so that's nice. Anyways we spent all day there before arriving pretty late, probably close to midnight, at the hotel. But they still had our room available and the man at reception was super nice and upbeat for it being so late. I didn't even feel like he treated us any differently because we technically weren't paying for the hotel room, rather using our rewards. He
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on trip advisor I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your trip to Anaheim and our hotel. We as a team also love the waffle station for our guests. We have currently been working on scenarios to break up traffic in our small breakfast space.  Currently we have added trays so that our guests can enjoy breakfast in their rooms and also are adding additional tables at the pool area to accommodate more guest during the breakfast hours. We look forward to your next arrival with us and thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: A 5 star rating does not mean it is a 5 star hotel, but merely that this property did everything one should be expecting in this price range...and did it well.  The rooms are well designed, comfortable and clean.  The included breakfast is respectable, even if the seating area is a bit cramped.  Plenty of free parking.  Heated outdoor pool and hot tub.  Location is good.  Staff friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience,  and look forward to your next stay with Towneplace Suites by Marriott.

Summary: I stayed here with family. Good hotel, nice clean rooms with kitchenette. Breakfast was good and it's very near to Disneyland. Overall I had a pretty nice stay. Would definitely recommend for families.
Manager Response: Hello guest,  Thank you for your time in reviewing us. We look forward to your next arrival and thank you for your continue patronage.  Yours in hospitality, Management

Summary: Our priority was to have two separate sleeping areas, so this provided us with a decent option at a good value.  There is actually more of a full kitchen than we expected or needed, so if you want that, then this is really a good value because the kitchen set-up is complete and nice in a compact way.  The rooms are small, and there's kind of an odd mix of outdated and worn elements (furniture, scratched door) with nice updates (granite counters in the bath and kitchen).  The elevator is like an old service elevator or something and we were originally put in a room right up against it and it was loud, so we asked to move.  The hotel is right next to the Amtrak line and our room was on that side but I didn't find it to be a problem - it's not like a heavy freight load or busy
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for reviewing us on Trip Advisor and taking time out of your busy schedule. We are glad you enjoyed our full kitchen and other amenities that the hotel offers. We have since your visit readjusted are breakfast set up so that we could break up the traffic within the breakfast area. As you stated the space is small for assisting our guests, Breakfast being a new standard amenity with Marriott TownePlace Suites trying to accommodate as many guests as we can is somewhat of a task, being an older generation TownePlace Suites.  We are confident that our new set up for breakfast will correct this issue. We will additionally be adding pool furniture so that our guests can have breakfast pool side and enjoy the awesome California sun while enjoying our continental breakfast. We look forward to assisting you in the future and please come back and see us soon so you can see our new addition to the pool area.

Summary Heading: Easy & convenient to Angels Stadium & food.
Summary: I stayed @ TownePlace Suites on the recommendation of my sister who stayed there last year for an Angels game. Yes I agree it is close to the Big A & the Amtrak/Metrolink train station. I walked from the train station to the hotel (10 minutes). I was happy cause I saw all the restaurants nearby (Denny's, Carl's Jr, Togo's Sandwiches, Panda Express, McDs). Check in was fast as the front desk personnel worked as a team to process three customers, myself included. I was assigned a first floor studio. I liked it. It was nice. It had all the amenities that I would need on this trip. Wireless internet was excellent.  Public Transportation is great. The ART stops right in front to take you to Disneyland. OCTA Route 50 took me to the Village @ Orange. Walking to the Anaheim Angels
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review us on Trip Advisor and I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your time here in Anaheim with us. We look forward to assisting you on your next visit.

Summary Heading: NG room w Excellent location Stadium Amtrak Restaurants
Summary: I did not like the room.  The bed was the worst & most bumpy bed i've ever slept on.  When I say bumpy I really mean bumpy.  The run down kitchenette area seems like such a waste of space.   I knew ahead of time that the room, furnishings etc..were old & dated from previous posts however o/a of its ideal location I had to stay here.   Although I disliked the room, I gave this hotel 4 stars because the front desk people were so so nice upon check-in & in the morning and because Angel stadium is a v short walk(8-9 min), as is Amtrak station (also 8-9min walk) as are restaurants & fast food joints (2-3min).   All of that is worth a lot to me.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on trip advisor. I am glad that our staff members were efficient and hospitable during your stay. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our location and its proximity to the local venues. I am sorry you felt we are outdated and the furnishings are old. Some of our soft goods are still being used from before the renovation as not all items were replaced which maybe what you are describing but, we completed our Marriott 12 year renovation end of January. We are very excited about our update. We hope that you will give us another opportunity to wow you the next time you are in the Anaheim area and thank you again for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great Stay for Trip to Disneyland
Summary: Convenient location for family trip to Disneyland.  ART Shuttle system picks up guests in front of hotel every 30 minutes to take to the Disney parks (purchase shuttle tickets at front desk.)  Hotel parking was easy and convenient.  Free breakfast, includes cold cereals, muffins, whole fruit, oatmeal packets, boxes of raisins, yogurt, bagels/english muffins, and make-your-own waffles.  Eating area is small, but guests cycled through quickly.  Loved the 1-bedroom suite for our family of 5, where we could put the 6 year old and 4 year old on the sofa pull-out sleeper in the living room area, shut the door to our bedroom, and put our 8 month old baby in the pack n' play in the [sliding-door] closet.  Mandatory to have separate, quiet and dark spaces to get kids to sleep versus
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  Thank you for reviewing us on Trip Advisor. I am happy to hear how much you enjoyed our one bedroom suite and that you had an amazing time at Disneyland. We look forward to assisting you in the future during your annual family Disney vacation. Till next time.  TownePlace Suites

Summary: I was in Anaheim for one night to attend the Angel/Mariners game and chose to stay here based on the location. Upon checking in(earlier than the stated check in time), they did not have any rooms availible. I was willing to wait, as I could throw my luggage in the rental car and go grab some food in the mean time. The nice lady at the front desk told me she had anothe room that I would like and checked me in. It was a 2 BR suite. Very nice and spacious. Too bad I was only staying here for a night because this room had plenty of room for me to stretch my legs. The room was clean and comfy. Thanks for the upgrade!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing us during your time frame in the Anaheim area. I am happy to hear that my staff went above and beyond to make sure that we could get you into a room as quickly as possible. I am glad you enjoyed our newly renovated two bedroom suite and we look forward to assisting you on a future stay with us.

Summary: Wow! What a great hotel! The room was clean and quiet, and the beds were more comfortable than our beds at home! All those fluffy pillows! The decor was "modern", which is not exactly my taste, but the four of us had plenty of space in our suite, and I loved the kitchen! The continental breakfast was yummy, and Denny's is right next door.  We traveled by Amtrak, the hotel was easily walkable from the station. Thanks for making our stay so relaxing.
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  Thank you for rating us on Trip Advisor. I am happy to hear you enjoyed your time here in Anaheim and we look forward to assisting you again on a future returning trip.

Summary: I only booked one night here for our Disney trip to use up points but I wish I had booked our entire stay at TownPlace.  It was great for our family of 5.  I liked that our suite was spacious with two bedrooms and a sofa bed; it was clean and the kitchenette was well stocked with dishes and silverware.  The Anaheim Resort Transit bus stops right in front of the hotel and a relatively quick ride to Disneyland. The only thing that I would suggest improvement on is the consistency of information the staff gives.  I got conflicting information on prices for the ART bus fares and the Concierge told me over the phone I could get certain types of Disney tickets which when I inquired at the front desk was told they did not have.  But other than that we had a great stay and would
Manager Response: Hello Guest,  Thank you for responding on Trip Advisor. I am happy to hear that you very much enjoyed your suite during your stay with us. I apologize for the inconvenience in the communication with the Anaheim Resort Transit. I will follow up with the staff to make sure that issue is corrected. As of 4/7/14 it is $5.00 for an adult age 10+ and $2.00 for children ages 3-9. The shuttle will run for the duration of the Disneyland park operating hours and based on the season will run either twice an hour or once an hour. Thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: Was given the wrong room...needed a handicapped room and was promised one...nope. Security lock outside was broken so anyone could come in the hotel at all hours....breakfast was not good either.  Juice was out of order, waffles were "out of regular" barely any fruit. Not impressed with this hotel. Won't be coming back here. Staff was friendly but didn't offer to fix the whole handicapped room situation even though we stayed two nights.
Manager Response: Thank you again for staying with us. After speaking with you prior to your departure in regards to this error with central reservations. We did follow up with our reservations manager at Marriott to make sure this type of incident doesn't happen again when a guest request is not applied to reservation. Thank you for bringing this to my attention when you checked out as I always like to make sure that guests are happy when they depart from the hotel. As we try and accommodate our guest the best we can by offering other solutions for things that fail which are out of our control. As we want all facets of the hotel experience to be exceptional. We appreciate your comments and concerns and all are being addressed and corrected. I hope that you will give us another opportunity to show you and your family that we are here to provide you with an excellent hospitable experience. We look forward to assisting you in your hotel accommodation in the future.

Summary: I was in Anaheim for business so I was not in need of a big resort hotel. This isn't a 5-star hotel nor are they trying to be. This was perfect for my needs. The rooms are updated, come with a full kitchen, and extremely clean. Housekeeping does a great job. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing us on Trip Advisor. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your time here in Anaheim. We look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: we got this place for very cheap and it was a 5 minute drive to Disney. the service was fine. My tv didn't work so they moved me to an upgraded room. the breakfast was surprisingly robust. we also went in February, which is one of the slowest times for Disney. perfect for a quick stay.
Manager Response: Hello guest and thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to Anaheim. We are very happy to hear that you had a great stay and time in Anaheim. I hope you made some great new memories at Disneyland and we look forward to your next arrival with us.  Yours in hospitality,  TPS Management

Summary Heading: Good location for  an Angels game
Summary: Our room a little crowed for a family of 4. Queen bed was comfy. Kitchenette was clean. Shower was clogged, maintenance came right away to fix the problem.  Hotel is about 2 miles to Disneyland and walking distance to Angels Stadium. Breakfast a little boring.  Overall, I was happy with my stay.  Friendly staff
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing us here on Trip Advisor and thank you so much for stay with us I am glad to hear that my staff member was able to correct that issue right away. We look forward to your next stay with us here in Anaheim.

Summary: The room was clean and had plenty of light. It has a small kitchen, complete with dishes and pans. The fridge is medium size, something you'd see in a garage or a small apt. The room is clean, and there is a sheet and blanket if you need the pull-out bed. As all pull-out beds are uncomfortable, I recommend removing the mattress and putting it on the floor. The kids do not mind and they consider it "camping" out. The breakfast was perfect. You had waffles, fruit, juice, yogurts, cereal, coffee all day long, hard boiled eggs, and muffins. Even though the area has tables set up, it can get crowded. I prefer to take everything back to the room. I made a few trips since I didn't have a tray.  Check-in was easy and they had a wheel to spin for extra Marriott points. I asked for the
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing us on Trip advisor I am glad to hear that you really enjoyed your time. We look forward to your next visit with us. We try and impact our guests as little as possible during any type of hotel improvement. Thank you again for staying.

Summary: Nice hotel. Rooms are decent. Recently renovated. My daughters and I stayed there in order to go to Disney. Even though it says Maingate it is about two miles from the park and is not really walkable. If you want that stay on Harbour. They offer free breakfast which is nice. But get there early. They only gave about 5 tables and it gets super crowded. They also have several restaurants closeby.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with us. I am happy to hear that you had a great stay with us. Happy Belated Birthday!! I apologized that there may have been a miscommunication in regards to main gate as we are main gate to the angel stadium. However, I am happy to hear that you enjoy your time here in Anaheim! We look forward to assisting in the future during your next trip to the Anaheim area.

Summary: We stay at this hotel every year same time for an event at Angel Stadium the 1st weekend in Jan.  We never have issues but when it rains it pours with this group...We checked in and they lost our reservation because I had called on a re-rate. They changed the name on the reservation, they changed it from a one bed to a studio and raised the rate from $109 to $129?   We booked in Oct but 1st of Nov they put up a disclaimer that the hotel is under remodel...but the disclaimer was not on the webpage when we booked. Remodel is an understatement its a train wreck. There was 4 or 6 couches piled up in front of a cargo bin just sitting there with some other ragged furniture and lamps in part of the parking lot.  Our 1st room was nice but getting to the room was a mess, floorboards
Manager Response: Thank you for rating us on trip advisor as we are always looking to improve our hotel and do well by all of our guests.  As most business professionals I was not available during the weekend while you were here at the property: however, we always have a manager on duty.  As we are currently undergoing renovations, we have the challenge of insuring that our hotel continues to operate with minimal disruption to our guests.   We understand that finding a mouse in your room can be an unnerving situation and tried to put you at ease for the duration of your stay.   My staff did need to relocate you to another room so that we could have an external company resolve the issue which has now been rectified and make sure that you had a comfortable and pest free stay.  I’m happy to see that my staff offered you an upgraded newly renovated accessibility suite that did not have any adjoining wall or door to the previous room.  We are sorry that you declined it.  My understanding is the manager also offered to purchase a shower chair as the remaining 16 accessible rooms were fully committed.  The Suite that you were relocated to was an upgraded suite as an additional apology for the issue that occurred.  In my email to you on Monday after you had departed I explained that the renovation construction team working in the building you had relocated to did in fact make scuff marks on the floor from the tires of the dolly's that they were using to move the larger furniture out of the rooms to make way for the new furniture that we were receiving.  As we placed you in an un-renovated suite for the final part of your stay, I can understand why you would feel it was out dated as the renovation is to give us a more modern and updated look and this suite had not been completed as of yet.   As per Marriott standard the renovation information was available to all guests as of the beginning of October prior to when your reservation was made.   Jeanette the Manager on duty removed your charges for the first night due to the mouse incident, while isolated, is unacceptable.  We sincerely apologize as no guest should ever experience that.  As you have stated, you have stayed with us numerous times and have never had any issues.  The room you noticed with the door opened was awaiting a new air conditioning unit, there is nothing in this room that would present a security issue for our guests.  We will also be purchasing some extra assistance chairs to accommodate past our eighteen accessibility rooms.   again our apologies that your stay was less than perfect.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to welcome you again during the annual super cross event at Angel Stadium.

Summary: The good, the Disneyland ART transport to Disneyland comes right to the hotel.  Walking distance to Honda center and Angel Stadium.  Rooms have a kitchen, beds and pillows not bad, in need of renovations which they have started.  Not so good, breakfast OK, basically continental.  The biggest problem I had was the cleanliness of the room, seemed fairly clean at first but noticed a couple of things. Without going into detail I almost left the room as I was so upset.  Talked with the front desk, rectified a couple of problems and the next day the room was cleaned spotlessly.  We had it booked for 5 days and we stayed for the five days.  If hotels close by were not all booked up I probably would have changed hotels.  That said it all worked out OK.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with us and reviewing us here on Trip Advisor. I apologize for the issues that you may have had during your stay, I am happy to hear that my staff was able to rectify those on your first day of arrival. It is unfortunate that you felt our breakfast was unsatisfactory. We added the waffle maker a few months ago, to give our guests the addition of a hot item. As guests felt the continental was not sufficient enough. I hope you will give us another opportunity to wow you with our property the next time you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you again for staying with us. Please let us know if we can assist you further in your future travels.

Summary: This hotel consists of two buildings in a nice area of Anaheim. I stayed here for 3 weeks in 3 different rooms on business.    I first noticed that all three rooms, although all somewhat similar in design, are very different in terms of different stages of life and maintenance.  One of my rooms, in the main building, had much newer furnishings and was designed better than the two rooms I had in the alternate building.  There was nothing technically "wrong" with any of the rooms; however, one definitely had a newer and more like-home feel.  The bed was nice in my opinion.  The pool area was very nice, and the complimentary breakfast was quite nice as well.    My one biggest complaint is the Wi-fi. This hotel has an absolutely terrible Wi-Fi Network.  No matter which room I was
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with TownePlace Suites Anaheim and for reviewing us here on Trip Advisor. I apologize that you seem to have issues with the internet as I have not had that issue come to my attention per other guests or my staff. However, I will follow up in regards to that to make sure that issue does not reoccur. It sounds like on your last visit you may have experienced one of our newly renovated suites if you moved from our second building to the first as that is where we started renovating our suites. We have been placing our guests in our second building to avoid any issues with the renovation as we know that noise and dust can impact one's stay, but very happy to hear that you enjoyed it. We will be completed with all of our suites end of January. Please come back and visit us again soon as we get more of our suites completed.  Thank you again for staying.

Summary: Had a wonderful vacation.  Everything at the TownPlace Suites was wonderful.  The staff was professional and courteous.  The room was clean and quiet.  The breakfast was fresh.  The shuttle to Disneyland was convenient.  They even found a room for us to check into at 10 A.M.  Could not have asked for anything more.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with us. I am happy to hear that you had such a great stay with us. Our staff is top notch they all enjoy what they do and are always looking to find new ways to assist our guests during their travels with us. We look forward to assisting in the future during your next trip to the Anaheim area. Till then M.I.C. See ya real soon....K.E.Y. Why? because we like you. M.O.U.S.E.

Summary Heading: Good clean hotel perfect location for Disneyland or Angels game
Summary: Stayed here the end of August with the family.  The Hotel is in a great location right next to the Stadium and a straight 5 minute shot to Disney.  Hotel was clean and friendly staff.  Breakfast was OK.  The hotel is outdated and needs to be refreshed.  Room size was good and kitchen stocked with plates, cups, etc.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you so much for staying with us. I am happy to hear how much you enjoy our staff and location. I do agree we are a bit of an older hotel. However if you come back and see us after the new year our suites and lobby will be completely renovated. All of us here at TPS Anaheim are very excited for this upgrade to our home. Thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to your next arrival and continuing to impress you with our staff service and our newly designed suites.

Summary Heading: Great hotel staff and good location but in need of renovation
Summary: I've stayed here 3 times now for a family trip to Disneyland.  I love your staff.  This trip, Annisa at the Front Desk was very helpful when we checked in.  I also stay here because it has free parking, and full kitchens.  We go to Anaheim 3-4 times a year and this has become our favorite hotel, primarily due to price and location.  With that said, as much as I like the staff and location, this hotel is in desperate need of a renovation.  I am sure the hotel is already working on making this happen but until it does, just know that things look a little shabby for now.  I was in a room with a hole in the front door.  It had a piece of tap over it that blended in with the wood on the door.  That's not fooling anybody.  This is just one example of course. This kind of things don't
Manager Response: Hello and thank you so much for staying with us. I am happy to hear how much you enjoy our staff and location. I do agree we are a bit of an older hotel. However if you come back and see us after the new year our suites and lobby will be completely renovated. All of us here at TPS Anaheim are very excited for this upgrade to our home. Thank you so much for your return visits we look forward to your next arrival and continuing to impress you with our staff service and our newly designed suites.

Summary: We stayed here for eight nights while vacationing.  The staff was amazing.  They were friendly and were more than willing to take the time to answer questions and give directions.  Housekeeping kept our room well stocked and clean.  The kitchen was nice and had a lot of supplies, though it could have used a pitcher.  There are no grocery stores nearby so bring your own groceries. It was great to have a guest laundry to use. The pool area is convenient and clean.  However, the pool was freezing and there was no change even after we brought it to the staff's attention.  There are several eating establishments just across the parking lot that are very reasonably priced.  Loved the free Wi Fi!  I will definitely stay here again when in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with us. I am glad to hear that you really enjoyed your time here in Anaheim with us. I apologize that the pool seem cool I will have that checked right away typically is set to 86 degrees and our spa at 102 degrees. We look forward to your next arrival and thank you again for staying with us and reviewing us on Trip Advisor.

Summary Heading: A Great Hotel for a Good Value
Summary: I checked into this hotel for a 4 day vacation and it was a great break from home. Firstly the area is locked off without a room key and to me that was a fancy touch The kitchen was nice and had all the supplies I needed along with internet and a great TV selection. Not only that but if you got hugrey at night they had a special little shop to sell you food.   Overall a great value for the money differently recommend
Manager Response: Hello...And thank you for staying with us during your time here in Anaheim. I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us. I too love our in a pinch market as sometimes I crave a little snack a roo midday. Safety is key for our guest here at our hotel. However we don't have issues with security as we are in a great neighborhood. Thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to your next arrival with us.

Summary: OK… Let’s get this out of the way… This hotel needs updating and apparently that process will be starting soon.  Now… the rooms are very clean and comfortable.  Everything works.  The location is perfect for a Disney vacation.  The parks are probably about a mile and a half away.  The place is just far enough away to be able to escape the madness, but still just a short trip.  I see where others have complained about the bus/shuttle to Disney.  I thought it was great.  For $5 you can go back and fourth between the hotel and the park all day.  Shuttles run every 30 minutes.  I went to the park early in the morning, came back to the hotel for a quick bite and a short nap and then returned to the park for the evening.  There are several family and fast food restaurants close by and
Manager Response: I want to start off by saying thank you so much for staying with and reviewing us on Trip Advisor. We are a bit of an older property, however we do our absolute best to shiny where we know we can make a huge impact on your stay, by making sure are rooms are cleaned to Marriott Standard and are staff is top notch. It one of the prideful things about this property we are extremely pleased with our staff. From the houseman who picks up our parking lot to the front desk agent that checks our guests in and out each has their own way of putting a personal touch in the property and the hospitality industry. We couldn't be more happy. I am glad you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your next arrival with us possibly after the new year to see our newly renovated suites. Thank you again.

Summary: I stayed for business and an extra day for pleasure. This hotel is convenient to everything, including Disneyland, which is only a few minutes drive time away. I noticed they also have a shuttle if you don't want to drive. The room was great with a kitchen and very comfortable bed. The pool was just the right temperature and the work out room was sufficient. There were grocery stores within a mile or so and restaurants within walking distance. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel if going to Disneyland, since you are just far enough away from the big crowds but close enough to drive or take the shuttle. The front desk staff was also very helpful describing how to get to local attractions.
Manager Response: Hello...And thank you for staying with I am so happy to hear that you were able to stay an extra day and play in Anaheim. There is so much to do here. It warms my heart to hear how much you enjoyed your stay. If there is anything additional that you need please contact us. We look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because we were in town for the Disney 1/2 Marathon.  We got the 2-bdrm suite which accommodated the 6 of us.  The room was clean but looked a little worn in the bathtub & living room area.  Pool area was small but worked.  The sofabed could use a new mattress, it was terrible with springs poking right into your back, could use more cushion.  Just surprised because Marriott can do better with this.  The best thing about the hotel were the people, friendly & informative.  Thank you to Gary at the front desk who allowed us to grab some breakfast food before we had to be at the marathon location by 5:30 AM.  There are also food places right next door (Panda Express, Carl's Jr, Starbucks, McDonalds) that you can walk to.  The hotel worked for one night
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and congratulations on completing the Disney Half Marathon. I agree we are an older hotel, however if you come back and visit us next year we will be completing our renovation with our new styled suites. I am happy to hear your room was up to Marriott Cleanliness and the staff went out of their way to assist you during your time with us. I have only good things to say about my staff as each has his or her own way of showing an extra touch of hospitality, as you experience with Gary. I will let him know of your acknowledgement on here. We are always looking for ways to praise our staff. Thank you for reviewing us on trip advisor and we look forward to assisting in a future reservation after our renovation.

Summary Heading: Not Bad Would stay there again if in the area
Summary: Being a Marriott it does have some great things to offer. I was disappointed that they had no airport shuttle. But being in the area it was located it was more of a family location than a business one. Rooms were not bad, comfortable. The outlets were worn out since many of my plug in devices had a problem staying plugged in. WiFi was good and I did not lose connection the entire stay. Only one elevator in the main building but it was fast enough didn't have long to wait. The nice thing about it was they did have a free bus service to local attractions, like Disney Land. Breakfast was so so, I am not a big cereal eater in the morning and that was the main food at breakfast. Again for family with kids this was a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for staying with us. Since we are so close to many of the local attractions in the Anaheim area typically we do get a lot of guests who are here for leisure stays. However our corporate guests are just as important to us. Sadly we do not have a shuttle to the airport, but we usually suggest the shared ride van through super shuttle as it is the most economical and the shuttle we most relay on. I will look into the outlets and follow up with our maintenance team to make sure this is corrected going forward. Thank you in assisting us with improving our hotel and reviewing us on trip advisor. We look forward to your next arrival with us.

Summary Heading: Poor experience, but the place was okay
Summary: We stayed recently at the beginning of August.  It was clean I will given them that.  But, they say there is a shuttle to Disneyland but it is $5 a person.  I feel that is costly.  It was better for the four of us to park at Disneyland for $15 and have in and out privileges unlike the shuttle.  I have $40 taken by the maids that the manager would do nothing about and damaged a phone cord that the manager did replace. When I do go back to Disneyland I will not be staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and apologize that you were miss informed in regards to the shuttle as it is a city provided service we have no say in the rates that they charge our guests. We just cut down the time frame it would take to go and purchase the tickets by selling them here at the hotel. In regards to the alleged thief as I remember speaking to you here at the property and will reiterate almost all of my housekeeping team has been here since the property was opened. It’s one of the most prideful things about this hotel; it has never had an issue with thief. The housekeeper who serviced your room has been an exemplary employee for the past 4 years that I have been the Assistant General Manager. She did however confirm that she bumped into your charger and we were happy to replace that for you as an apology. I am sorry that your experience was not a positive one and hope that you will give us another opportunity to wow you and your family as your son seemed to really enjoy the spin the wheel free beverage and the surprise Disney gift card.

Summary: I stayed here in Anaheim in mid August 2013 after reading many reviews. I reserved the 2 bedroom "suite" which only has 1 bathroom and the rooms are extremely small, hence the tiny beds (that claim to be doubles). We are a family of six- 2 adults and four children - 14 to 4 and the space was quite cramped. The hotel needs updating- furnishings are worn out. The drawers in the rooms were scratched and lights were quite dim in the bedroom. The "full size" kitchen is ok but rather small and the utensils and plates were not in the best condition. The breakfast area is very small and extremely limited. the staff was very friendly but I was overall disappointed that this is a Marriott property. I opted to only spend one night here and changed hotels the next day to give everyone
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us I apologize that your stay was not a pleasant one. Thank you for bring this to our attention as this will only help us improve. We are an older hotel, however I do hope you will give us another opportunity next year as we will have completed our renovation with our suites being a huge focus. I hope you enjoy your time in Anaheim. We look forward to hopefully accommodating you on a future stay.

Summary: Just departed from a week long stay at TPS Anaheim.  Pros - great location, basically across the street from Angels Stadium & across the freeway from the Honda Center, 10 minutes to Disney, clean, large refrigerator, nice pool & hot tub, great water pressure, cheap ($1) laundry facilities; quiet family hotel; great, friendly & helpful front desk & maintenance staff.  Cons - one slow elevator for the building; depending upon where your room is, the regular commuter train can bother you, some of the furnishings are dated, wifi is extremely, extremely slow, very small breakfast area - easier to take it back to your room.  I've stayed at TPS Anaheim before and I would say it has lost some of its charm, but it is definitely a great family hotel, providing value for the room and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We are glad you enjoyed your long term stay with us as that is what TownePlace Suites is all about. The Location is one of my favorite parts about this hotel as it is close to just about everything here in Anaheim. I hope you were able to use our suites kitchen to cook some great home style meals before leaving us. I apologize that we are a little bit of an older hotel however, If you come back and see us in the new year we will have our new renovation completed. All the staff here are very excited for it. We look forward to your next arrival with us. Thanks again for staying.

Summary: We had a 2nd floor suite and never heard the trains running past the hotel nor traffic noises from the fast food parking lots.  No noisy footsteps above or outside hallways either.  No TV noise from rooms next door.  The room had a full-size fridge, stove, oven, dishwasher, sink, coffeemaker, toaster.  Pots, baking pans, utensils, dish soap, dish rags, plates, bowls, glasses, and cups.  The freezer had two ice cube trays we used up daily.  I loved the large desk and rolling table.  Plenty of drawers, cabinets, and shelves to put stuff away.  I was surprised that the room had so many electrical outlets to choose from to plug in our chargers and devices.  Free Wi-fi was decent speed and never dropped.  There are two TVs.  The single full-size bed was adequate but took awhile to
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing us for your stay in Anaheim. We are proud to have provided you with a great experience and thank you for reviewing us here. We are happy to say that the train station has now turned the state college crossing into a quite zone. So the train horn is no longer a problem for our guests. I apologize for the milk incident as we try and plan to the best of our ability to make sure that we have ample food and beverages for our guests. However sometime we do have things that happen out of our control but appreciate your patience and enjoying our other options for breakfast. We look forward to your next arrival with us and thank you again for staying.

Summary Heading: Convenient, Clean Easy Access for Disneyland visit
Summary: For a very quick trip to Disneyland we stayed at the Townplace Suites.  The lobby and rooms are small but well organized and clean.  The free breakfast was a hit but the small lobby can get crowded early in the morning as everyone heads out to Disneyland. Easy shuttle service from the hotel directly to Disneyland.  There is a pool but we were too tired to take advantage of it!   Good selection of family freindly restaurant and entertainment options right next to the hotel so all around a very good choice.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. I am glad that your family enjoyed your time here with us. Maybe next time you can take advantage of our pool area the next time your in the Anaheim area. We look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our party of 6 visiting Disneyland and Southern California.  With spacious 1 and 2 bedroom suites with full kitchens this hotel allowed us to have ample room for our entire party for the long week.  The kitchen, while limited, was sufficient in providing us with a few cooked meals on the busy vacation.  The hotel is about 3 miles from Disneyland, so driving is pretty necessary but an easy drive none the less.  Super close to Angels stadium, which is within walking distance.  Average free breakfast with cereal, bagels and muffins, and fruit.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We appreciate your compliments to the hotel. We are always looking for ways to improve or praise our staff and thank you for your time in review us here on trip advisor. We look forward to your next arrival here at TownePlace Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Hospitable staff, clean, and close to ball field!
Summary: We came with all 5 in our family on the 4th of July.  They had root beer floats in the lobby so the kids were happy!  There was plenty of room (only in there to sleep).  The kids had a blast in the pool (small/outdoor but did the job!).  Clean, everything worked, friendly smiling staff, will def use again! My only disappointment...breakfast.  No waffle maker, hard boiled eggs, etc like most Marriott's offer.  Just juice, muffins, and a little fruit.  Plus, Denny's is right across the parking lot! and their staff rocked!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We are glad you enjoyed our Root beer floats we try and do something a little extra during the holidays for our guests as we know it is an important and fun time for you. We take all of our guest’s feedback into consideration and we will look into expanding our breakfast to meet our guest’s needs. We are always looking for ways to improve or praise our staff and thank you for your time in review us here on trip advisor. We look forward to your next arrival here at TownePlace Suites Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights due to a pipe burst in our home, so this trip was not for pleasure.  We booked a two bedroom suite with a kitchen, as we had two kids with us.  I can say that the stay was very pleasant considering the circumstances, the kids enjoyed the pool and we walked to Angel stadium for a game.  The breakfast was just fine, both bagels and English muffins offered with peanut butter and cream cheese.  An entire wall of cold cereals were  offered and you could make instant oatmeal if you prefer plus juice, fruit and yogurt.    The room was clean but it appeared that a previous guests dog had got to the door.  We don't travel with our dog, so I can't relate to those that insist on doing so but the damage was new.  The front desk was totally on top of our needs and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. I am sorry to hear about your pipe problem at home. We are glad your family enjoyed our pool and easy walk to the stadium. We take all of our guest’s feedback seriously and we will follow up with our maintenance team to correct that issue with the door. We are always looking for ways to improve or praise our staff and will let Nydia know of your mention here. Thank you for your time in review us here on trip advisor. We look forward to your next arrival here at TownePlace Suites Anaheim.

Summary Heading: The staff at this hotel are so very welcoming!
Summary: I'm on the road the majority of the year with work so I've seen a great deal of range to say the least.  But this TownePlace Suites is in my top five places to stay--especially since it is for work!  Though it is walking distance to Angels Stadium and Honda Center and only a short shuttle to the Disneyland attractions...it is the staff that make this my favorite.  They make me feel welcome, valued and a part of the family. I briefly read through a couple of previous reviews--and as expected, you mention something and they make it better.  The toilet paper and paper towels are now top quality, the breakfasts are still a great value for the money (free!!) but definitely keep you on the healthy side.  Free parking is a plus in California as well...and the heated pool/jacuzzi are
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We are extremely happy that you enjoy your stays her with us. As we want every guest to feel like they are apart of our Marriott Family.Thank you for your time in reviewing us here on trip advisor. We look forward to your next arrival here at TownePlace Suites Anaheim.

Summary: Close to good resturants and an easy walk to the Angels baseball stadium.  Room was clean & quiet.  Staff very friendly & helpful.  Breakfast was typical for a continental breakfast, a Denny's & Starbucks were just around the corner.  Will stay here again when I return
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very very conveniently located to Honda Center, Anaheim stadium, restaurants, Starbucks. Nice safe area. Our room was overlooking pool and noise echoed in our room until 10PM. Halls were loud with people talking. By the number of kids present it's obviously a popular place for Disney goers. So it is what it is. Rooms were old and need of updating. I'm sure they get more than their fair share of abuse. But not terrible by any means. Nice to have a kitchenette. And the AM breakfast buffet was good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value with points for Disneyland Visitors
Summary: I tend to be pretty loyal to Marriott brands and built up quite a bank of Marriott points, so when I went to book a room in Anaheim for a trip to Disneyland using my points I booked the Towneplace Suites for three reasons:   (1) It was a much better value than any of the other Marriott properties in Anaheim, as it was a Category 3 for points redemption while the others were at least a Category 5. (2) It was the only Marriott property in Anaheim that did not charge a daily parking fee.  (3) Free continental breakfast. I tend to be pretty cost conscious, so I would much rather fill up on a free hotel breakfast than pay for fast food or worse pay Disneyland food prices.  I still had a few doubts, but I went into the stay with an open mind and wasn't disappointed. My biggest
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect place for the family to stay.
Summary: This was our most recent trip to Disneyland. This being our first stay at this particular hotel I was unsure what to expect. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly. The check in process was painless. Once I we got I to our rooms they were spacious and roomy. The seperate rooms were perfect for our little kids. The room was clean. The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes. The checkout process was totally painless.  The only knock on the hotel was the grab and go breakfast as opposed to a hot breakfast as at many other Townplace Suites we have stayed at. We were able to take the ART shuttle which stopped in the hotel parking lot. This was more convenient than driving and parking at Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband is a Marriott rewards member and does an extensive amount of traveling.  We found this Towneplace Suites property on the Marriott website and booked it for 4 nights.  My husband and I checked in late night and met "Gary", the night auditor.  He was very cordial, hospitable and professional.  Gary made us feel welcome and we were greatly pleased to have chosen this hotel because of the customer service that Gary and Joy, (another night auditor) have provvided to us.  They both have a positive, can-do attitude that makes traveling and being on the road a much more pleasant experience.  "Mike", the nighyt houseman, was also very helpful to deliver items we needed in the middle of the night.  In short, this night shift crew is a great crew for this hotel to have when
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel because we have a family of 6 and we need a place that would have breakfast to save that money. We purchased a package that stated this hotel would have a full breakfast daily. Because there was a "change in owners" the breakfast was nutri grain bars, muffins, oranges and bananas and instant oatmeal you make yourself. We were very disappointed with this. For this reason we would not go back to this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are a couple 45/55 and a friend and her 6yr, old son  We stayed 4 nights and paid $140+tax per night.  This hotel is1.86ml to disney and behind a plaza with a Denny's bank Starbucks and a Mexican place.  It is hard to see this hotel from the street.  It is 2 detached  buildings with a small pool and parking is free and plentiful.  The train runs right beyond the parking lot so you hear it and see it.  I like that but some may hate it.  check -in---we arrived at 9pm and were greated by a nice young guy and check in took 2minutes.  we were in the other building 4th floor.  The building is a rectangle and it had, 2 entrance doors but only one elevator? so we had to walk the whole hall to get to our room.  There wre no luggage carts, or at least they were not where they were
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No place to sleep but on the floor
Summary: After a long day at Disney we arrived at our hotel around 8:00pm.  After checking in and taking out luggage to the room we discovered that the couch pull out bed was completely broken.  We had only been in the room about 5 minutes.  I went to the desk to ask about changing rooms or having the bed fixed.  They would not move us and the bed was ...not repairable.  SO, we literally had to remove the mattress from the couch and place it on the floor to sleep.  NOT ACCEPTABLE  for a Marriott Brand Hotel.   The room price was not reduced or any concessions made for our horrible night.  I am a Marriott lover, but I may have to consider changing my hotel brand.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not what I expect from a Marriott property
Summary: First the good; the staff was very pleasant and always helpful. The size of the suite was decent. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom vanity lighting was bright. They offer a cold breakfast of yogurt, fruit and cereal in the am.   Now the needs improvement; The rooms cost less than a Residence Inn so I didn’t expect them to have as nice of carpeting, furniture or countertops. The condition of the rooms is another story. A fresh coat of paint, lights by the bed that you could read by, a door on the closet and a bathroom door that would stay open would do a lot to improve the place. All could be done for minimal cost. I checked in and tested the faucets and shower to ensure they worked. When I took a shower before bed, the water started pooling around my feet immediately.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were not overly impressed. As long as you plan on using the kitchen to cook breakfast and don't rely on them then you wont go hungry.  My daughter had a pair of earrings come up missing after we were gone all day??  I would suggest to keep looking. You can get better for your money. Don't plan on using the hide away either, we had to ask for many blankets so my boys didn't get killed by springs. Some good: parking is free, food is walking distance, shuttle picks you up for parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good place for families going to Disneyland
Summary: Our studio suite was clean and comfortable.  Staff was friendly.  The kitchen was very nice and there is a good size fridge.  You can save money cooking meals.  We went to a nearby Von's and stocked up.  Bathroom was okay.  The sofa bed was not the greatest, but I slept okay on it.  Breakfast and coffee are sub-par, but you can grab a few things easily to take with you as a snack later.  There is a lobby with computer and printer - we printed Disneyland tickets here.  The WiFi works great - stream Netflix, etc.  Nice cardio equipment in fitness room, but no weights.  Convenient laundry area - $1 to wash and $1 to dry for 30 minutes.  We to the #15 shuttle to Disneyland.  We did not know to buy tickets at the hotel for a discount, but the nice driver gave us a discounted ride
Manager Response: none

Summary: Only spent a couple of nights on this occasion which was our 5th stay at this property.  We arrived early morning but they were able to offer us a room straight away which we appreciated after an overnight flight from Australia.  Once again we chose this hotel because it is an easy walk to Honda Centre to watch the hockey and not too far away from Disney and oultet shopping at The Block at Orange.
