The next morning we were surprised to learn that the breakfast had changed from a good selection of cereals, yoghurt, etc to a very ordinary offering of prepackaged nasties.  It would have been better if there was no breakfast offered, either do it properly or not at all!    As the rooms have a kitchenette with oven, fridge and microwave, it is easy to self cater.  Our room was clean
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was a great choice for our theme park vacation.  It had a full kitchen (oven/stove, full sized fridge, coffee maker, toaster, dishes, pots & pans, dishwasher), a nice desk with wifi and wired internet (although I couldn't get the wired internet to work on my laptop so had to use wifi), plenty of storage (cubby holes above the desk, cabinets, drawers, and a large closet with lots of hangers, and two night stands with drawers), a sofabed, and a comfy chair.    The bed had upgraded bedding, but the mattress was a little firm for my comfort.  The hotel also has free parking, and there is a center with a Starbucks, Denny's, and Carl's Jr. in walking distance.  There was a Walmart Neighborhood Market (grocery store) just a few miles away, so we stocked up on breakfast food.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If you enjoy a hot or nice continental breakfast - don't stay here!
Summary: We've stayed here for the last 2 years for spring and fall breaks because we can park in the front, it has 2 bedroom suites, kitchen and living room.  Rooms are clean (I did find a snack from the previous guests in the kitchen cabinets), front desk is nice, but the breakfast is appalling! The breakfast has got to be the worst in town now! when we first started going there it was a decent continental, now there is extreme slim pickings - if you dare eat it - my kids were throwing up on the way home after drinking the apple juice (they probably don't clean out the dispenser!)  The breakfast area is tiny and there is usually an employee to greet you (or to see you don't take more than you should of their yucky prepackaged breakfast items) There is no milk or cereal, yogurt.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Front desk staff is smarmy and rude, but if you can get past that...
Summary: ...the place itself isn't too bad for the money (assuming your rate is down near $100).  Free parking and free wifi, along with a (small) kitchen are nice.  And unlike many other nearby hotels they actually have a nice assortment of TV channels.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bad experience, haven't even stayed there yet!
Summary: We booked this hotel months in advance for our upcoming Disneyland vacation carefully taking into consideration all our options of the many comparable hotels in Anaheim. Less than two weeks before our arrival date an email notification came to advise us the pool would be closed for maintenance for the majority of our stay! Now I am aware that this is necessary, however in all of my past experiences any type of scheduled maintenance is clearly disclosed well in advance. Upon a call to the hotel's manager to discuss this concern, no apology or compensation was offered, and she even encouraged us to look into other hotel options! With less than two weeks to go entering a busy season, clearly most hotels are already booked. Very unprofessional and disappointing is my option of this
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here with our 2 children several times on recent trips to Disneyland.  It's a good, economical choice.  It has an acceptable free breakfast -- you order the day before and pick it up in the morning -- with choices like cereal, oatmeal, pastries, etc.  I like that the rooms have a kitchen, making it easier to bring food in and eat on a dime.  The hotel is about 10 minutes by freeway from Disneyland.  We prefer to pay for parking, and stay further away.  We have done the hotel strip thing and shuttle service and don't care for it at all.  Leaving by car gets you home faster and the restaurants further away have better pricing. Housekeeping service was spotty, but all in all, it was a comfortable base for visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Older hotel, but terrific Disneyland family value
Summary: Huge benefits and inclusions make this a fantastic choice for families or for just about anyone wanting more room space, a full kitchenette, free parking, and excellent overall value.  Sure, this is an older hotel, but is clean and kept up well.  Staff are kind, attentive, and ready to assist on anything they can (especially with local recommendations, Disney advice for novices, and other services).  Any other critiques would be minor quibbles.  Outstanding spot for Angel Stadium or Honda Center nearby, the hotel is admittedly a bit far from Disney (but where isn't, as few closer-in places are realistically walkable) though either a taxi or the local Anaheim shuttle (buy a multi-day pass for a better deal) is far superior to driving to and parking at Disneyland.  Also, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just an average, dated facility but well located   Would be great for families on a budget.  We actually ended up in a suite with a couple of bedrooms and full kitchen.   Staff very accommodating. Lots of fast food nearby.  We walked to our event at The Grove. Breakfast was typical but fine   A good value for travelers
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older hotel, and it showed in the furnishings. Pool was warm, spa was too hot for some. Breakfast was typical TownePlace Suites - uninspiring but predictable. The staff were friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place if you are visiting Disneyland
Summary: Nice suite with seperate bedroom and fold out couch, and FULL kitchen!  Super nice front desk staff and easy, although basic, breakfast. 2 minutes to Dinseyland (they also have a $4 shuttle, which is easier than parking at Disnyland!) What is so nice is there are many dining options all around-including a Togo's and Subway you can walk to if you want to take a picnic into the park. Also starbucks nearby.  A better price than those near Disney, and much nicer room! We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I did review right when we checked in before we finished our stat. And this was way back in September. So to finish it. When we first came we switched rooms twice because they smelt like smoke but our third room was in the main building and was terrific. In my opinion, the breakfast system was awesome. It may be inconvenient to some but it was nice to us. The only unexpected part was that our car broke down and it was supposed to be a guys night out but my sister and my mom came out to get us. But it was walking distance to the Angels stadium so that was a plus side. We went to see the space shuttle (forgot which one, the one that just flew in) fly by us and we went to Disneyland parking garages to see it. And the drive wasn't too bad. So we know its really close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place for family with kids. 1 - 2 bedroom suite with kitchen, the property inside and outside is clean and well maintained. Good breakfast, free and fast WiFi to. close to angel stadium, Disneyland is a 5min drive. Restaurants and *bucks across the parking lot. Not your dad Marriott but great for family that do not have marriott $$ Good place to stay at Towne Place Anaheim.   Yes I Recommend
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Sometimes you jut get what you pay for...
Summary: I wanted to try a new Disney hotel option and we gave this place a try.  Needless today we won't be back. The price was fantastic and now I know why! This hotel is just old, the ceilings are low it feels very budget if you know what I mean?! The front desk guy was super nice and helpful but that's the only plus here. The breakfast was really weird and really bad! They give you a slip of paper and have you pre- order and take it to your room. Not a fan of this and the muffins tasted like they came straight from Dow chemical.... Blah!! Thumbs down on this property!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel. These reviews definitely assist in improving upon and maintaining a high level of guest satisfaction for all our guests. We are happy to hear you were provided with friendly and helpful service and appreciate the acknowledgement of our staff member(s). Nevertheless, your comments will be examined more closely. Again, thank you and we look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: I was more than satisfied with my stay here. The rooms were clean and the full kitchen was nice. The staff was fabulous and helped us with anything possible. Good location close to Honda Center and Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Staff Is Still Amazing, Rooms Need Updating
Summary: I stayed at this hotel once again and let me say that John, Lupe, Mike, Deborah and all of the staff were really exceptional. This goes for housekeeping and maintenance as well. They remember your name, anticipate your needs and go out of the way to assist you with everything. For this reason alone I'd stay here again.  The breakfast procedure has changed since I last visited. Now you fill out a form in the evening and hand it in with a designated pick-up time for the items you want. I'm guessing they were getting cleaned out by families stocking up for day trips to Disneyland and this was one way to combat it. However, I often forgot to do this or selected a time for pick-up that turned out to be inconvenient when the next morning rolled around. They were kind enough to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we are delighted to hear the staff provided you with amazing helpful and friendly service, in particularly thank you for acknowledging our staff by name. Our staff takes great pride in providing the best possible experience for all our guests. We truly value your review and we are looking forward to our hotel renovation in 2013, as it’s in the planning stages right now. We look forward to your next visit with us and happily remain at your service!

Summary: Great location with nice surroundings and food options. Worked well for group of 15 attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. Easy access to Disneyland and Downtown Disney as well. Very freindly staff and definately a safe environment. Would reccomend and will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay in a lot of Marriott's, and have Gold status.  This is not as nice as what I expect from Marriott.  The staff is friendly and the property outside is well maintained, the pool area was clean. The rooms however have made me decide not to stay here next time I'm in town (I'm travelling to Anaheim for business).  First of all, it smells like old-hotel-used-to-be-a-smoking-room. For a suite it is very small and awkwardly laid out. Where the tub meets the floor has some awkward trim laid that doesn't match up with the wall or the tub. As a result, there was a lot of blackness lurking and that grosses me out in a bathroom.  Housekeeping kept turning off my AC which resulted in me coming back to a stuffy, off smelling hotel room each night. It was 100F outside during the day,
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, all the feedback from our valued guests help us immensely in being able to better provide a comfortable and great stay for all our guests. We are happy to hear that the staff was friendly though at the same time we are terribly sorry that you experienced some inconveniences with your guest room and our complimentary grab n’ go breakfast. We will definitely review your comments more closely in order to address them appropriately. Additionally, we are happy to say that a renovation is on order for the hotel, although it does operate with a preventative maintenance program. Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to better serve you in the future.

Summary: Had a great trip over to Disneyland and the "2012 Gay Days, Anaheim"! Stayed with friends who happened to book with points so the stay was free for us. We were in a 1 Bedroom Suite, with a comfortable pull-out couch. Kitchen area was nice and clean! And staff were great! Special shout-out to Mike, Graham, and Lupe for being very knowledgeable and providing great customer service!  Breakfast was decent. But then again, anything is good for being free, huh? They have breakfast slips for you to fill out and hand to the Front Desk the evening before. The next morning, you stop by their cafe and pick up your breakfast that is already prepared for you. Breakfast items included Hard-Boiled Eggs, Cereal, Yogurt, Juices, and Fruit.  Thanks again for an awesome visit!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not quite up to Marriott standards in my book
Summary: We stayed here two nights because we were going to disneyland for two days.  I stay at Marriott's quite a bit for work so I had a couple of free nights from Marriott and this is one of the hotels we could stay in.  I usually can count on Marriotts to be quite nice but.......  I was surprised to see hair in the sink, on the ledge above the toilet and in the toilet.  This just always grosses me out in any hotel that I stay in.  I expect them to be clean. The bathroom also had drippy stains on the wall and where the tub meets the floor was pretty dirty too.  The couch in the "suite" also had a huge stain on it.  Needless to say I did not sit there. The beds are also very small in this hotel.  They say they are queens but they seem more like fulls.  I asked to be moved to a room
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we are pleased to hear that the staff was friendly and the hotel’s location provided some good accessibility. We do sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced in your room during your stay. We are excited to announce that there are plans for a renovation next year and comments from our valued guests continuously assist us in making improvements to our overall operation. Our ultimate goal is provide a great experience for all our guests.  Again thank you for your review, we hope to be able to better serve you in the near future and happily remain at your service.

Summary Heading: Can't beat this one for value
Summary: This place has a lot going for it ...  1.  Super friendly staff.  Everyone greeted me nicely and acted like they actually cared.  Wow - what a concept!  I wish more businesses had employees like this. 2.  Convenient location.  It's an easy walk to Angels' Stadium and the Honda Center.  For Disneyland, there's a shuttle that picks up passengers in front of the hotel every hour. 3.  Freebies.  Free wifi, free parking, and free breakfast (order the night ahead; continental-style offerings such as cereal, English muffin, bagels, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, regular muffins). 4.  Kitchens.  Full size refrigerator, electric burner stove, dishwasher, full sink, and ample cabinets/counter space.  Also stocked with pots, pans, dishes, and utensils. 5.  Couches.  The layout is like a small
Manager Response: none

Summary: WE stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was great for 2 couples.   We each had our own bedroom and a 'living room' for relaxing. The kitchenette was great for snacks and to get a break from restuarants.  The beds were excellent.  The staff was friendly and accomodating and provided excellent customer service.  The only negative was the hide-a-bed couch in our room was quite beat up and not very comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just checked into our hotel about 1 hour ago and have already been in 3 rooms. The first 2 smelt like smoke so we moved. Our final room is ok and we are staying in this 1. Even though I just killed a spider in here but no big deal. It is right next to Angels Staduim and just a few miles from Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we truly appreciate your feedback as it allows us to look into any issues or concerns at hand by our valued guests more closely. We truly apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced and the matter at hand will be looked into more closely. Again thank you and happily remain at your service.

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and it was perfect for a family with young children. Having come for a very posh hotel it was nice to be able to relax a bit and let the kids be kids. We loved being able to get the ART to almost anywhere we wanted to go. The staff were fantastic to deal with both as an adult and with the children. The pool was great and we spent many hours in here. We actually stayed July 2009 and I was sure I'd done a review but it appears not, so here it is. I would highly recommmend this place if you want a little bit of space
Manager Response: none

Summary: Late getting this review in but....  stayed here for 6 days starting Memorial Day weekend.   Two rooms for two families.    Great staff that provided exceptional service!!   Rooms were comfortable.  Little kitchen was great for meals.  Easy access via shuttle to Disneyland, very short walk to Angel Stadium.   Bottom line, it was  clean, comfortable, with great service.   The pool was awesome.   We used their Grill in the pool area one evening.   Would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed the workout room, really good equipment. The location was excellent for the Angles vs Tampa Bay Rays Game! This facility has full kitchens in room and smells of many different cultures cooking! The swimming pool is about the size of the one in my backyard. There are many places to eat close by either walking or driving.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are in town for an Angels baseball game, this is the place for you.  First, you can walk right to the stadium~no traffic, no parking hassles. The rooms are spacious enough, with a small kitchen area and sleeper sofa.  Every morning you get a boxed breakfast, the items which you choose the day before. The hotel is near many convenience food stores as well as major highways, so if you are travelling out of the area, it is easy to find your way around. The most lasting impression of this hotel for me was the staff.  We had a reservation for a Tuesday night.  We drove down from San Francisco and had originally planned on staying somewhere further north for Monday night.  While driving, we decided to go the whole way to Anaheim.  I called the hotel to see if they had our room
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my first time staying at a Towne Suites property.   Pros:  1. Good location. There are places to eat within walking distance: Panda Express, Denny’s( was told if you tell Denny’s you are staying at the hotel they give you a 10% discount. We did not try this), McDonalds, Starbucks, Etc. Also it is about three (3) blocks from Angel stadium.  2. Good for Disneyland. Other reviews said there is a Disneyland bus that picks you up from the hotel. I did not try this out, as we had a parking pass for the amusement park.  3. Employees.  Employees were nice and helpful. 4. Parking. Plenty of parking and they do not charge to park. 5. Two 24” flat screen tvs. One in the bedroom and one in the living room. 6. Paul Mitchell travel size shampoo, conditioner and hand lotion.  7.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the TownePlace Suites Anaheim, all our guest comments are very valuable to us in being able to always improve upon or maintain a high level of guest satisfaction.  We are happy to read that you found the hotel’s location to be convenient - located across the street from the stadium, walking distance to Honda Center and restaurants. We do apologize for the inconvenience you might have experienced with your guest room. Your feedback will definitely be looked into more closely, as our ultimate goal is to provide a great experience for each and every guest. Again thank you and we look forward to serving you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel has very nice rooms.  The pool and hot tub are quite nice.  Breakfast to go is served, bagels, eggs, fruit, muffins, cereal, juice, yogurt, milk etc.    I have to recognize Graham and Deborah, front desk associates for simply outstanding customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From check-in to check-out this is an amazing place to stay. We spent 4 nights in a row & from early check-in to late check-out we received everything way beyond our expectations. If you happen to meet Mike OR Deborah in the front desk; as we did, you would say to yourself "guyes you made my day". Receiving two bottles of cold drinking water when the outside temperature is 30+ at the time of check-in was like a heavenly gift. The idea of ordering the complimentary breakfast the previous night and receiving it at your desired time next morning was so unique that we really looked forward to it every morning. The room was designed in such a manner that will make you feel as if you are staying in your home. Be it the front desk managers or the cleaning lady or the breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just what you want from a hotel!
Summary: We stayed only one night for a quick trip to Disneyland.  We arrived about an hour before check in, but they had a room ready so we were able to check in.  Being a Marriott member they gave us 2 bottles of cold water, just what we needed after a 4 hour drive.  The room was clean, plenty of room, full kitchenette, what more could you need.  Free parking is a  plus, since many of the Anaheim Hotels do charge for parking.  They had free breakfast, put in your order before 11pm, and pick it up in the lobby the next morning.   I would have given it 5 stars, but while checking out I had a slight problem.  There was no one at the desk, so I went to ask another staff member who gives out the breakfast if they could call someone to the front desk. I got a real attitude from them, very
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were absolutely pleased with our accommodations!! The hotel was clean, friendly and a great location. I have no negative feedback. I could not have asked for a better hotel for the price. The customer service was excellent and I hope to get to work with this property again if we are in the area again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay for an Angel Game!
Summary: New, very clean hotel that is right accross the street from Angel Stadium. The hotel is average for evrything else. Nice place for a family stay. Small kitchen with full size appliances allows you to save a lot of money on food costs. Also, save money by walking to the Angel game. Lots of restaurants just next door. Best place to stay for Angel fans!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room is set up very nicely with a couch, chair, flat screen TV, large table for a desk and chair. It has a kitchenette with a small electric stove, full size frig, dishwasher, toaster, and small microwave, coffee maker. It is equipped with normal supplies like dishes, silverware, etc.  there is an iron and board.  There is coffee, sugar, salt, pepper in room  It appears there is internet because there is a wire to hookup the computer (I did not use). There is free wifi throughout the hotel  Hair dryer, with shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap bars, lotion. The bathroom has a full length mirror.  There is a ice machine down the hall. The lobby has free coffee all day, 2 computers, printer.  There is a shuttle that you pay a fee that takes you to the Market Place
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would most definitely stay here again. If you want everything in walking distance don't stay here. If you want a great, new, clean hotel room that won't break the bank then this is your place. The one bedrooms are great for parents traveling with kids, couples or friends traveling together. The seperate bedroom has a good size closest and a chest of drawers. There is also a nice new flat screen tv. There is a pull out couch that sleeps two in the living area. There is a large screen tv and an extra chair. There is an entire work space as well. If you need to work while you are here it has everything and is very comfortable. The bathrooms are the basic tub shower combination. Popcorn is served at night and there is coffee 24 hours. They also have a breakfast menu card that you
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect location for a trip to the ball game! Cut across their parking lot & cross the street, walk past the Grove theater, and you're at the ballpark. That parking lot has several inexpensive places to buy a supper you can carry into the stadium. There are also a couple of sports bar & grill places across the street. The staff at the hotel was most cheerful and helpful even though the place was mobbed with families on vacation. Free coffee in the lobby. Helpful painted wall map with magnets showing the location of anything in the area you might need. The brown bag breakfast you select the night before and pick up at your selected time the next morning was convenient to eat in your kitchenette, or take "to go".  OJ was a 12 oz bottle of fresh-squeezed Tropicana!  Or there's a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for families n teams
Summary: The hotel was excellent... Just the right size .. We had 2 volleyball teams with lots of family members too!     Front desk very accomodating!  Friendly and helpful staff!  Breakfast was more than enough, the hot cocoa/coffee throughout the day was a nice amenity.  Starbucks, dennys, McDonald's are just a few of the nearby places to eat.  (within walking distance).  Could not hear the train at night that some people were mentioning.
Manager Response: none

Summary: TPS Anaheim is super convienient and just across the street from Angels Stadium.  Its great to catch a game after a long day (Angels havent been too good lately so tickets always easy).  I travel here on business and its so convienient with the kitchenette to just make a quick breakfast in the room.  Clean rooms and great staff who always remember and take care of me.  I kinda find it refreshing too to not be surrounded by all  cranky business men but also the kids who are super excited and ready to go see Mickey.  Great little Mexican restaurant just across the parking lot and an upscale place for happy hour within 100 yards too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Upon first glance, the Marriott Town Suites in Anaheim seems like a typical Marriott property.  Clean property, well maintained and nicely furnished.  The front counter staff is pleasant and courteous.  However, upon closer inspection, the property is suffering from gradual disrepair.  The unit we stayed in was chock full of issues. The biggest and probably the deadliest was the loose light switch in the bathroom.  I received a shock strong enough to stun me for a second.  I can't imagine what would have happened if my young daughter tried to turn off the switch instead of me.  Front desk apologized with a smile and said maintenance would take care of it.  I guess if I was still standing, it couldn't have been that bad.   The carpet was filthy.  Our socks were black from walking
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay while visiting the Anaheim area. We were delighted to read that you encountered a pleasant and courteous staff. Although we are truly sorry for the inconveniences you encountered in your room and with the grab n’go breakfast. The hotel does maintain a high level of housekeeping policies and procedures, including a preventative maintenance program to keep the hotel and its fittings in first-rate working order. However, we really appreciate your feedback and all matters will be examined closer as our ultimate desire is to provide an enjoyable experience for all our current and future guests. We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you again in the future and happily remain at your service.

Summary Heading: Nice, out-of-the-way location and free parking
Summary: I travel on business to the Anaheim area and prefer this hotel for price, location, and convenience.  The studio arrangement with kitchenette is great for cooking a meal or keeping your own juices and snacks.  You can stock the fridge at one of the grocery stores on State College Avenue.  The staff are always helpful.  Whenever I've had a problem, they have always been very responsive.  Parking is free, and there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance or a short drive.  The Disney shuttle stops in the parking lot if you are heading to the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were spacious and clean with a well equipped kitchen which really helped us save on food costs. The breakfasts were OK (they take your order the night before and then place your selections in a sack to take back to your room). Nice pool and small but adequate workout room (a stairmaster, reclining bike, and treadmill). The hotel is very clean and the staff very courteous with excellent customer service. Would stay here again and recommend to friends and family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are a full travel sports team and choose to stay at TownPlace Suites for our last 4 day tournament of the year; I wish we had stayed her the entire season! The rooms, and entire hotel, were exceptionally clean, rooms were quiet, the kitchens came with an oven, the pool area was perfect and the staff was extremely friendly and professional. The location was great; close to anything that you would need, yet far enough from Disneyland to not have to get caught in that traffic. We had 11 rooms in all so we had to go through the sales manager who continually went out of her way to ensure that everything would be perfect for our stay. We will definitively be staying here again and I will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was great.  The workers at the front desk are all nice and very helpful.  All the rooms are suites and they are all very clean and spacious.  The best thing about it is the proximity to Angel Stadium.  We went to go watch the Giants play the Angels for two days and the hotel is literally across the street from the stadium.  They even let you choose what you want from their continental breakfast when you check in and have it ready for you to pick up in the morning in the lobby.  There are also places to eat very close by and although we didn't get in (not enough time) the pool it looked clean and like a nice place to relax.  I will definitely stay here again whenever I am in Anaheim, great hotel for a great price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location, free parking, free wireless, nice workstation in room.  For breakfast you have a selection of fruit, cereal, bagels, yogurt, juices.  Check off what you want and what time you want it.  Head down to the hotel lobby and it's all bagged and ready for you to take back to your room.  Room is comfortable, and space to feel comfortable.  Good choice for hotel, conventient to attractions.  Good restaurants in walking distance, I recommend The Catch Restaurant for an excellent meal!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed here many times and have always been happy.  Great location for Angels games and for all OC attractions / close to freeways.   Staff this time were even better than usual ... extremely helpful when asked for room upgrade, early breakfast, etc.   Decent laundry facilities and workout room.  Excellent value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hotel since other family had already booked at this location and we wanted to be together. I didn't have high expectations, but this didn't meet the bar. This would be a fine location for an Angel's game, but there are other hotels closer to Disney for comparable rates. Had to pay for Disney parking or take the Anaheim shuttle to Disney for around $3 each way.  The hotel is quite old and they have tried to make the most of what they have with a fresh coat of paint, etc., but the room felt worn and a bit grubby down to the bathtub that had some weird worn mark in it, sticky carpet (eww), and the light on my nightstand that was never replaced/fixed despite repeated requests to the front desk. The walls were thin and the TV was awkwardly placed on a side table that
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel. We are happy to hear that the staff was helpful during your stay. While we offer complimentary parking for all hotel guests, the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) is the city’s transit system to all the area attractions, furthermore the hotel was able to have an assigned shuttle stop in front of the hotel, although the shuttle fees are directly assigned by ART. Additionally, we do apologize that you encountered some inconveniences with your room. Nevertheless, we will review your observations closely, as these reviews greatly help us improve upon the current and future stays of all our guests. We look forward to you giving us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future and happily remain at your service.

Summary Heading: Great Location For Disney, Angels Game or Honda Center
Summary: I stayed one night at the TownePlace Suites for an Angels game.  The location was fantastic.  It was a quick walk to the stadium and I was there in no time.  The front desk of the hotel was friendly, the room was clean and the price was perfect.  The location was a short drive for events at the Honda Center or Disneyland.   I had a room on the ground floor by the pool.  During the day it was a bit noisy since the weather was nice but not a problem for me.  Parking was free and convenient.  The grab and go breakfast was a little different.  I was hoping for something hot but the bagel and yogurt hit the spot for the drive home.  The room I was in was a little small for a family but would be great for a couple.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I absolutely was impressed by this hotel! Its walking distance from food, the Angel Stadium and freeway access. The kitchenette is the best and wished I would have stayed longer to take more advantage of it, nice comfy bed with comfy pillows, clean restaurant and wonderful staff. The continental breakfast is great and saves at least $10 a person. We got bagels, oatmeal fruit, coffee and juice all in a cute little bag and picked up in the morning. They run a tight clean ship and I will definitley stay here again !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Continental Breakfast/Grab & Go Breakfast is not what you are expecting
Summary: A business associate and I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past several years.  Recently they have made some odd changes regarding how they handle the complimentary breakfast.  It is not what you expect at any other hotel in America.  In order to get the breakfast you must fill out a form the night before.  You may not eat in the lobby.  If fact they eliminated the dining area altogether.  There is a sign in the elevator that says you are expected to bring your breakfast to your room.  My room was on the fourth floor of a separate building from the lobby.  You may not pick up your food yourself.  There is a counter where employees fill your order from the form.  The form says to order responsibly for the number of people in your party.  I find that offensive.  If
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest and continuously choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim for your lodging needs. We truly apologize for any inconvenience the new breakfast procedures may have caused you. Our ultimate desire is to be able to meet every guest’s needs and the new breakfast measures is an attempt to eliminate the morning congestion along with wait times by allowing our guests to pre-order their breakfasts in order for the staff to prepare so they are ready to grab and go or consumed in the privacy of their guest rooms. Complimentary coffee plus a variety of teas are still served in the lobby 24hrs. Additionally, the Market is open onsite in the lobby offering for purchase beverages, light meal options and snacks. We appreciate your review and will take your comments into closer examination, as we are always looking for ways to better serve all our guests and provide a great stay. Again, thank you and we happily remain at your service.

Summary: As our main reason for visiting Anahiem is to attend sporting events, this is a great venue as it is within easy walking distance of the Honda Centre and Angel Stadium.  We usually stay in a queen studio, which offers plenty of room for 2 including a well equipped kitchen.  On this our 4th stay at Towneplace, we were pleasantly surprised to find that breakfast is now included in the cost of the room, and although they were still working through the logistics of how to provide the best breakfast service to guests, there was a good selection of cereals, pastries, etc. available.   The staff are always friendly and helpful, the rooms and common areas are clean and spacious & there is plenty free parking.   If you are intending to go to Disneyland, the shuttle bus stops at the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great low cost hotel, Disneyland, Angel Stadium!!
Summary: We fly in every jan, simple Shuttle from SNA (John Wayne, or LAX)  Staff are very nice helpful and friendly, lots of simple food places share same parking lot.  Daily shuttles to Disneyland with out all the crowds.  Rooms nice, clean and roomy, with full kitchens to heat up meals or take out.  Walk to Angel Stadium!  Great stay for the cost!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Going to baseball-stay here!  Disnleyland maybe not.
Summary: Overall it wasn't a horrible stay.   We wanted a suite since we were travelling with a baby and child. We were also going to disnleyland and wanted to be able to prep our lunches and come back to make dinner.  The kitchens had everything you need!.   The breakfast provided each morning was impressive.    We first booked into a studio which didn't have a functioning bathtub so we very quickly got upgraded to a two bedroom suite which was extremely impressive.   Loads of space.    The first day our room got cLeaned the cleaners "accidentally" threw away my sons baby of baby food, formula and all his supplies.  They say it was mistaken for garbage.  After a mad dash to Target only a few minutes away is able to replace everything.   They gave us a discount on our room.   Don't know
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim for your stay. We are delighted to hear the kitchen in the guest room supplied everything you needed and found the complimentary morning breakfast impressive. Additionally, we are very truly sorry that your son's supplies were thrown away by accident. This issue will definitely be addressed in order to prevent this from happening again in the future, please accept our apologies. In addition, the hotel does offer an Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle stop right outside the front of the hotel and travels to Disneyland for a small fee; it usually makes stops every hour daily during Disney’s operating hours. The ART tickets can be purchased at our front desk daily and they are good for all day, so you can go back and forth as many times as you wish. We apologize if this was not offered to you upon check-in. Again, thank you for your review of the hotel as these reviews assist us in continuously looking at ways to enhance the stays of all our current and future guests.

Summary: My husband and I just completed a stay here and really loved it.  The staff could not be more accommodating.  Kitchens are really kitchens equipped a working oven.  We barbequed steaks on the outside grill by the pool.  However, do this before the sun goes down.  There isn't much light in that area after dark.   We did have small red ants upon arrival and they moved us to another, more expensive room without charge.  Fantastic staff.  This is really the only place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is the place for me.
Summary: I can’t say enough about the TownPlace Suites, this is the only place I stay when I’m in town, I’ve stayed in different rooms and I’ve never had a problem with noise in spite of the fact that the train is close by. The Staff is friendly and I’ve never had a problem checking in whether it’s day or night. The rooms are always clean very modern and very inviting after a long hard traveling day. The location is perfect for dining and entertainment, because everything is walking distance. I would definitely highly recommend this Hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I very much enjoyed my three night stay at the TownPlace Suites. I have stayed here a number of different occasions and have not been bothered by the trains even though i am a light sleeper My room large well planned out use of space, mini kitchen with full fridge, dishwasher, dishes and a small 2 burner stovetop electric range, and very clean, It was great. and Very comfortable Free internet that connected easily and quickly, no special codes required. They have a  complimentary breakfast that was very good, pancakes, bagels, english muffins, various yogurts, oatmeal, coffee, tea, juices, milks, hot chocolate. easily accessible from the freeway with lots to do and see within walking distance. The staff very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend you stay here, there is  shuttle
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Over 60 nights there in two years
Summary: While i was on the Supercross circuit,  Me and my staff stayed over 60 nights at the towne place suites.  The staff did great, always great to us.  I know they arnt the fanciest rooms.  But for what we were doing and the kitchens and the availablity of places to eat close, gym  everything we needed.  I miss the nice days we spent there!!  cant say enough about the place
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a four night stay at this hotel. I made the mistake of ignoring the bad reviews about the trains - the price and location for our family of 5 seemed like a good deal and I figured I could just request a room 'away from the train tracks' like previous reviewers had suggested. Here's the reality - there is NO ESCAPE from the train noise. It makes no difference which room you are in, this hotel is practically on the tracks and the horns start up sometimes as early as 4.30am and as late as 10pm. Unless you really can sleep through ANYTHING or can get by on a few hours sleep a night, please do yourself a favor and book somewhere else. There are many many choices out there. On the plus side, the hotel staff are all very nice, and the hotel itself is fine, but
Manager Response: none

Summary: On our third night of four, my girlfriend and I couldn’t sleep and were lying in bed talking at about 4 a.m. She got up to use the bathroom and when she returned she noticed a bug on the top sheet towards the foot of the bed. I grabbed a tissue, picked it up and took it to the bathroom to flush it down the toilet. I noticed it was an unusual looking bug, flat like a tick. I turned my computer on, curious to see what it was and found out that in fact it was an adult bed bug.  We looked around the bedding and pillows to see if there were any more and then called the front desk to see about getting a new room. We were told it was completely booked.  I asked them to change all the linen in the room and clean it as we would be at Disneyland all day and didn’t have the time to check
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize that the room you initially received did not obtain the level of guest satisfaction you deserve. While our hotel operates with a preventative program to make certain our hotel and its fittings are all maintained; this is an industry wide problem and unavoidable at times and we take this very seriously. We are again truly sorry for the inconvenience this may have caused. We appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention in order to rectify and eliminate the problem from our hotel, which also comprises of replacing mattresses, replacing all linens and calling in a professional company within our industry to further aid in eliminating the problem immediately. Thank you for your feedback as it allows us to further improve upon the present and future stays for all our guests.

Summary Heading: Great location in Anaheim for Honda Center and quick access to freeway
Summary: We stayed here for two nights in November 2011.  Our purpose of the trip was to see our Vancouver Canucks hockey team play the LA Kings and the Anaheim Ducks. Hotel was very clean and seemed quite new.  Free parking and breakfast included. Booked it through expedia. Front desk staff were exceptionally nice, chatted with us about our visit to Anaheim, gave us directions to shopping. Room was nice, functional, queen bed and pull out sofa.  Free internet that connected easily and quickly, no special codes required. Room had small kitchenette with fridge, microwave etc. Complimentary breakfast was very good, pancakes, bagels, english muffins, various yogurts, oatmeal, coffee, tea, juices, milks, hot chocolate.  Could have used some jam, only had pb, honey and grape jelly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I came to Anaheim from Arizona for the weekend.  Upon arrival we were greeted by wonderful staff, very helpful even printed out a list of restaurants for us, We had dinner at the Catch walking distance away.  Our room was lovely, A two bedroom with full kitchen very comfortable  Spacious but still felt cozy  It's a great place to stay if you are wanting to go to the many attractions in and around Anaheim: proximity to Angels Stadium, The Grove, The Honda Center, The Block and Disneyland by using ART shuttle which has a stop directly in front of the hotel with tickets available at the front desk.  Breakfast included.There is also Free Coffee, Tea & Hot Chocolate available in the lobby 24 hours.  This was our first stay here and it won't be our last!! Thanks Guys
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location near Disney with a shuttle for $4 per person to the park. We stayed in October 2011 and paid $161 for the largest room they had because we were travelling with our 2 teenaged boys and wanted them to have their own bed.  The pull out mattress was paper thin and not adequate for my youngest son who is 100lbs.  When the pull out is set up it takes up the entire living room and makes getting to the phone or tv impossible.  The hotel is located right beside the train tracks with lots of traffic that start early and run late.   Every time the train would pass they would blow the horn to clear the intersection.  That generally started around 5:30am and would happen every 15 or 20 minutes.  We had planned on staying there for 3 nights and arrived late the first night.
Manager Response: We sincerely appreciate your review of our hotel. We are delighted you found our hotel to have a great location and truly apologize that the sofa beds were not as comfortable as you would have liked. Our hotel does operate with a Preventative Maintenance program in place to make certain our hotel and its fitting are all kept up. We will look into the matter more closely. While the trains are out of our control, we do recommend for our lighter sleepers to possibly request a room that is located towards the front of the property. The trains tend to run more frequently during morning rush hour and less frequent in the afternoons and with even larger gaps on the weekends. Thank you again for your feedback as it allows us to further improve upon the present and future stays for all our guests.

Summary: I wasn't sure about this hotel at first from reading the reviews but once I finished my stay I was hooked.  I was running late and the staff were polite on the phone letting me know they switched my reservation to a late arrival. Once I arrived I found that the refrigerator wasn't working properly. The guy at the front desk was there to help me within 5 min since the maintenance guy wasn't there at that time. He ended up getting me a new room and some free ice cream for my trouble plus helped me carry my things since I was alone. The new room was just as nice as the other one with a freezing cold fridge which was perfect.  The only cons I have with this hotel are the trains and Disneyland/ Angel stadium fireworks can be pretty loud but if you bring some earplugs then no biggie
Manager Response: none

Summary: I choose this hotel since I was arriving in Anaheim by train and did not want to rent a car.  This hotel is a great if you wish to attend a baseball or hockey game since you can walk to either venue.  I arrived in Anaheim via Amtrak and the walk to the hotel was about 10 minutes. The walk to the ball game also took about 10 minutes.  The Honda Center is about a 15 minute walk.   A great selection of restaurant were within walking distance.  Staff was nice and friendly.  Will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decided not to stay 2nd night because of AWFUL smelly bldg. & room
Summary: Let me premise this review with .... (1) I often stay at Marriot sub-brand hotels from Courtyard, Fairfield Inn, to Springhill Suites for 30+ nights/year. This is not the 1st time for me to use TownPlace.  Stayed there to be nearby UCI hospital.  My family was given room in bldg. next to lobby/receptionist building. Lobby bldg was clean & typical of what I expect. Next building over had this overwhelming bad stench upon entering the building, in the old & squeeky elevator and along the halls of our room. You can tell this was an old bldg. Upon entering room, bad stench was not so strong but still noticeable. My whole family noticed bad stench & even my kids. We decided to stay only 1 nite bc did not like what we had to experience for an overnight stay.  I expressed my
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We sincerely apologize for the unpleasant stench you smelled during your stay with us and did not receive the response you were looking for from our front desk. At times certain cooking smells can linger, as we are an extended stay hotel and offer fully equipped kitchens. We do have housekeeping procedures we follow on a daily basis to maintain a specific level of freshness throughout the hotel. Additionally, while our hotel is less than 12 years old we underwent a major renovation a few years back and we have a in place a Preventative Maintenance program to ascertain our hotel and its fittings are all continuously kept up to the highest level possible. Nevertheless, your concerns will definitely be looked into and we certainly appreciate your feedback as it allows us to further improve upon the present and future stays for all our guests.

Summary: The hotel itself is quite new and in great shape. My room was scrupulously clean and the furnishings and finish, whilst not high end, were good quality. Every member of staff I interacted with was very pleasant. The Free Breakfast was basically just cereals and muffins, but hey its Free! As the title of my review might imply, I was extremely disappointed with the internet service. Both the wireless and the wired connections were very slow and often non-existent. I was trying to work from the room and ended up having to go to Starbucks. I did call reception and ask if there were any problems with the internet. The "Telling" response was: "You are the first person to call tonight. I'll call and have them re-set it"... My other gripe is that the Television service is not HD,
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim Maingate for your stay. We are excited to hear that you found the hotel, its furnishings and amenities to be of good quality. We certainly apologize for your internet experience and please know that we are actually in the process of upgrading the internet speed throughout the hotel. We definitely strive to keep up with technology, though there are times where the upgrade projects can take a little bit longer to complete. Thank you again for your review as it allows us to examine more closely on how we can improve upon and continue to provide a great stay for all our guests.

Summary: We stayed there for 5 nights and it was the best choice for a family of 2 adults and 1 child. We choose the suite with full kitchen but finally we didn't much used it. It is a real kitchen with a stove, dishwasher, large fridge, all ustensile, etc. The location is a little bit off down town of Anaheim (Disneyland), but only 5 minutes by car. The pool was very clean and not very busy. What we appreciate is that there was a bbq on the patio close to the pool. There is a shuttle service but we didn't used it. The room was always super clean and enough space for us. It is a continental breakfast and everymorning not enough space for eveybody.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, good value, we'd go back
Summary: We selected this hotel because we could use Marriott Rewards and it was close to Disneyland.  We had two one bedroom suites.  One room was very clean and nice.  The other room smelled like someone smoked in it.  The manager had all the linens changed and they used special sprays to clear out the smell.  It helped a little.  They could not move us because they were completely full.  We didn't spend too much time in the room anyway as we were at the theme parks long hours.  The breakfast was fair, the first day no one was assigned to the breakfast and the desk clerk was trying hard to keep up.  There were a lot of people trying to get food in a very small space.  We had to take food back to the room as there were no tables on two occasions.  There is a train near one wing, so ask
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim for your Disney trip and are excited to see that you would stay with us again, discovering good value and a positive experience at the TownePlace Suites Anaheim. We apologize one of your rooms smelled like smoke - our hotel is 100% smoke free and we thank you for pointing the matter out to us so it could be addressed. We also appreciate your patience and understanding during this busy season at the hotel. Your comments are valuable in assisting us to determine how to maintain and bring a great positive stay to all our guests. We look forward to you visiting us again and happily remain at your service!

Summary: Our room had a Br, LR, BA, and Kitchen.  Breakfast was standard hotel fair, but free.  Friendly staff, pool was cloudy but hot tub was hot.  Starbucks 200 yards away as were several nice eateries.  5 minute drive to Disney, Knotts, and I-5.  I wouldn't venture more than two blocks from the hotel on foot due to the make up of the neighborhood.  If you have kids this is probably a better value than the on-site Disney hotels.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Humid room, dirty common areas, otherwise fine
Summary: The exterior of the hotel and the lobby look great! The interior of the room was clean.  However, it was very humid in the room and the two air conditioners could not remove the humidity.  After the first two days of our week long stay, when we would leave for the day, we would leave the windows open to bring drier outside air in but, during the evening, the room reminded us of living in a tropical rain forest.  Also, the common areas where the vending machines were, the laundry room, etc, were very dirty.  I would not recommend staying here unless you can be assured that the room won't be amazingly humid.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the TownePlace Suites Anaheim for your extended stay and for your review of our hotel. We are happy to know that your accommodation was clean and you very much liked the appearance of additional hotel features. On another note, we truly apologize that your room felt humid during your stay. While our weather is normally dry in southern California, we do experience some humidity from monsoon weather conditions on occasions. However, we will definitely look into this matter further and evaluate the performance of our air conditioning units. Again, thank your for your review as it provides helpful insight and adds on our continuous efforts to provide all our guests with a great stay!

Summary Heading: Great hotel & service.  We'll be back
Summary: We had a group of families stay at the TownePlace Suites for a recent sports event, and we had a great stay at the hotel.  The rooms were comfortable and included a kitchen for our gametime snacks.  The team members met at the pool to relax after their games and enjoyed the complimentary breakfast in the morning.   The Sales Manager, Jane, was extraordinarily helpful in arranging a team dinner across the street at El Torito.  The food was great, we had a private room and the convenience of walking across the street to eat was wonderful.  Jane was also very helpful in insuring that all families had rooms before the hotel sold out,  so that we all could be at one location.  We would definitely stay here again when visiting Anaheim
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you and your families all had a great stay at our TownePlace Suites in Anaheim during your recent sports event. Thank you for recognizing Jane, we are very proud of our staff for their hard work and dedication to the hotel and above all our guests! We look forward to your group visiting us again in the near future and we will happily remain at your service.

Summary Heading: Fantastic service for my large group
Summary: As a professional meeting planner I must recommend this hotel highly.  From start to finish, working with the sale office, the front office and the management everything went along perfectly.  I had 40+ rooms at the hotel for an extended stay and every single person was pleased.  I will certainly bring any additional business I have in the area back to the TownePlace Suites!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, but light sleepers be warned......
Summary: My wife and a number of her co-workers were staying here for 2 weeks while working at the nearby convention center, I decided to tag along for 5 nights. The rooms come equipped with a small kitchen which is good for extended stays, however you would need a car as there is no grocery store within walking distance.  The hotel is about a mile from Disneyland and the convention center, but is reight beside Angels Stadium and has some decent restaurants within walking distance.   The biggest issue I had with the hotel is the noise from the trains passing by as the rail line is directly behind the hotel.  The temperature was very comfortable in the evening so we left the windows open, big mistake. I was awakened at 4.30am by a train going through with its horn blaring, if you've seen
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff + Convenient Location = Happy Guest
Summary: TownePlace Suites is walking distance from the Grove of Anaheim!   After an eventful night, TownePlace is my home away from home.  I enjoy staying here because the Staff is professional, friendly, and attentive to your needs.    Also, the room is perfect for business stays.  The desk area is big and allows you to create your working space comfortably.    The breakfast station they provide is a great start to your day, as well!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding Customer Service in an Outstanding Location
Summary: Close to Disneyland, Honda Center, and Anaheim Angel Stadium.  Exceptional staff is very helpful and goes out of their way to provide top notch Customer Service. This hotel is a great value in a great location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is wonderful.  The room was very comfortable and cozy it felt more like a studio apartment than a hotel room. Most comfortable bed I have slept in at any hotel.  The kitchens in the rooms were an extra bonus, which is great for longer stays. The Staff are wonderful very helpful and always accommodating to your every need.  Internet and parking are free. Breakfast was simple but good. They have cereals, toast, eggs, yogurt, fruits, muffins.. Also free coffee in the morning, warm fresh cookies in the afternoon.  The best thing for me was how quiet the rooms were I expected to be able to hear people in the other rooms, but that wasn’t the case thank goodness since I am a very light sleeper! Yes there are trains that pass by but I wasn’t disturbed at all.  You can get a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay, close to everything, great service, helpful staff!
Summary: I took a group of Jr. High students for a day at Disney and we stayed at Towne Place Suites in Anaheim.  If you're riding the train, the station is close to the hotel.  There are several fast food places nearby and the Anaheim Resort Transit picks up here for Disneyland.  The continental breakfast is good.  Rooms are nice and clean and have a kitchenette if you want to save money on food.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location, Terrific Spot for Families
Summary: My husband & I stayed with our 5 year old while we attended to back-to-back games at Angels Stadium. It was an easy walk to the ballpark from the hotel (even for our little one), so we saved on stadium parking & the traffic leaving the game. The room was great with a terrific set up allowing us to have privacy in the separate bedroom with our little one on the sleep sofa. The fact that the bathroom was off the kitchen (instead of the bedroom) meant that our little one didn't wake us in a middle-of-the-night potty break. Breakfast had a wide array of continental-type foods & the quality of the fresh fruit, make-your-own waffles, etc. was high. We stayed in building B on the front side (odd-numbered rooms) & it was a weekend so the train noise was non-existent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for an extended period for work and I cannot say enough good things about the staff here. John and Lupe were AWESOME and went out of their way to help me with everything from shipping a package to dry cleaning to locating a good place to eat. I also got great service from the housekeeping and maintenance department when I had small issues arise.  The hotel rooms are a bit older, but if you're a family headed for Disneyland or staying for an extended period of time, this can't be beat. Great value, complimentary breakfast, parking, internet, AND the ability to prepare meals in your own room. Stop by the lobby and they always have coffee and yummy cookies most afternoons. I was also pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was (I never heard my neighbors and I
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent extended stay and for acknowledging our amazing staff! We are extremely pleased you were provided with excellent customer service, as they take great pride in creating a good experience for all our guests. Additionally, we are excited to let you know that we have upgraded all our tube TVs in each guest room to 32” flat screen TVs. We happily remain at your service and look forward to having you and your affiliates stay with us soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while watching Angels get THUMPED!
Summary: I am not a Angels fan. I am a Dodgers fan. I came here for the All Star game weekend July 2010. Its a standard faire TownePlace. The staff is polite, the room has had some lipstick and mascara put over a 20 year old building. Its serviceable, and generally nice, but not high end, or over the top. It's better than most. We got a 2 bedroom suite, one room barely held a queen bed, the other was more roomy. The bathroom is small and generic. The kitchen is the same, but serves the purpose. Location is great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with a group of friends
Summary: I worked with the sales department to reserve a block of rooms for a family event nearby.  The Marriott did not disappoint!  The blocked rooms had competitive rates, and were all located near each other.  The kitchens in the rooms were an extra bonus, and allowed for socializing later after our event.  The best part about the stay was the attention received from the staff -- from the sales dept to the front desk, everyone was friendly and we felt we received individual attention to our needs.  A birthday was being celebrated, and a gift was waiting in the room -- such a wonderful gesture.  I would definitely use this establishment again in the future.

Summary: The hotel was a fine Marriott...the staff is what made it great. I left my cell phone charger and the front desk staff called me to let me know then sent the charger to me via USPS that day.  The jacuzzi.was PIPING hot...

Summary: Stayed there 4 nights with our kids.  Got a single room with 1 queen bed and a sofa. The sofa bed was not so comfortable as you could feel the spring.  But the staff were very kind to provide a seperate bed.  If it weren't for the additional bed, the space would have been great, but that's not the fault of the hotel.  Room is clean and very comfortable.  We rented with a kitchenette so there was a nice seperate kitchen location with full utensils.  Internet and parking was free.  Breakfast was simple but good. They had cereals, toast, fruits, muffins.. all of which was good enough to get you going for the day.  It was a very comfortable stay.  A couple of restaurants within walking distance and more shops and grocery stores within driving distance.  It is less than 5 mins drive

Summary Heading: Great value & good location for Disneyland & Angels Stadium
Summary: Would definitely stay here again every time I visit Disneyland. I have stayed in other hotels on Harbor Blvd. that are right next to or across from the parks, but these hotels are always crowded with families & kids, and parking is an additional fee. Here at TownePlace, it's only a few minutes drive from the parks and without all of the family crowds. Plus, each room as a kitchen and desk. Lots of room. Also, it's right across from Angels Stadium and the Amtrak Station. In the same block, there are many restaurants & a Starbucks and a Bally's Fitness.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The people at the front desk were so nice, but if the trains don't keep you awake, the city busses and low riders will (especially on Saturday nights).   College Blvd is extremely busy and the building did not feel sound proofed at all.   We had room 401.  It was as far from the trains as possible, but the noises from the street were constant.  I used ear plugs, but still hardly slept.    I was surprised with the selection available at the grab and go breakfast.  They offered a lot more than I expected and it would be easy to make a meal out of it.  They also had a computer / printer that was handy for printing boarding passes.

Summary: We picked this hotel for our Disney trip based on the mostly good reviews.  I did see some complaints about train noise, but I lived by a train track in college and it never really bothered me, so I ignored it.  I feel badly saying this because I'm not sure what the hotel can do the remedy the issue, but the train noise was HORRIBLE!!  The train is literally right next to the hotel and not only do you hear the very loud train noise, but it has to toot it's horn several times because it is crossing the intersection.  The tooting was the worst part!  The commuter train does stop at 11 at night, but starts up bright and early at 4:45 with its big toots and continues every 20-30 minutes!!!  We had to switch our hotel!

Summary: An update to my previous review. I had commented that the exercise room was small with only 3 machines. They now offer a voucher for a free workout at Bally's Fitness (next door). They've also apparently upgraded the Internet connection, because the free wireless is speedy. In my opinion, this is the best value in Anaheim!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is awesome. My husband and I are Disney annual passholders and travel to this area every 6-8 weeks and often stay at TownePlace Suites. We love that they have an ART stop right outside the lobby. We can park in the Disney garage for free but prefer to take the ART because it's less of a hassle than getting to and from the garage. Our rooms are always clean, love the Marriott beds and anytime we have a complaint or need something (like extra shampoo or pillows) it taken care of immediately. It's also one of the best values you're going to find this close to Disney/Angel Stadium.

Summary Heading: Can't beat what you get for the price
Summary: This place has everything you need if you have kids but is a no frills hotel. For $99 a night you get a one bedroom suite with a queen in the bedroom and a pullout in the living room. Fridge is small but all it is adequate. Anything else in the area that provides the same amenities is at least $70 more a night. Breakfast is a bit light, but the Denny’s across the parking lot gives a 10% discount with room key. Walk to Angles stadium, drives 3 miles to Disney. We are planning on making this our place to stay as we now have an annual pass to Disney.  Nothing fancy, but if you want a bedroom and living room to separate sleeping kids from up adults, you’ll find no better bargain than this.

Summary Heading: A convenient hotel with good service and amenities!
Summary: A recent stay in Anaheim at the TownePlace Suites has us wanting to return to this convenient and friendly hotel.  We just returned from a three night stay (Saturday to Tuesday) and was definitely surprised with what we got there.  Our room had a queen bed, a sofa bed, kitchen, and full desk.  We were commenting that this room was definitely roomier than other places we've stayed.  They are located on the ART bus route #15, which ended up being our way to get to CA Adventure.  For only $4 for an all day pass, it's definitely worth it.  We were glad we didn't have to  park at the resort as they drop you off right at the gates to the parks.  Breakfast includes cereals, muffins, bagels, English muffins, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, and juices.  It's true that they breakfast area

Summary Heading: Nothing Special but Convenient to Angels Game
Summary: My brother and I stayed here for one night while were in Anaheim for some Angels games. We checked in shortly before a game Tuesday night and stayed through to see Wednesday afternoon's contest as well (our Red Sox swept that series, I may add).  Anyhow, this place certainly is convenient to Angel Stadium. The hotel is no more than a five minute walk (just a block or two, really) from the park. The parking is plentiful and free, so you can certainly just leave the car there. The location really is the selling point: you are within walking distance of plenty of restaurants (mostly chains) and, of course, Disneyland. We were traveling with an infant and a toddler. I was cringing at the thought of them being on the floor. My crawler's pants were filthy after about 5 minutes. The furniture was ripped and sagging. That made a great start!! and it just got better.   He made sure we had plenty of towels, and also gave us some popcorn and cookies which was very much appreciated by my two hungry teenager boys! I am a marriott member and I would not stay there again. Hard and small beds and dont ask for a king size they dont have any at all or thats what i was told i tell you there really confused of their own place.

Summary Heading: Location ideal for many OC activities
Summary: The hotel is basically adjacent to the Anaheim Angels stadium, we walked to the game in about 5 minutes.  It's only 2 miles or so to Disneyland too.  The Amtrak station is also very close.  We got a 2 bedroom suite for our family of four and a fifth adult slept on the pullout.  A little tight on space, but very much worth the value, especially for our short (1 night) stay.  Our room was in the primary building (the one with the lobby) and the 2 BR units in this building face the train tracks.  Our kids loved it, but others may not appreciate it, though we didn't notice any noise from the trains at night.  Also realized that you have a clear view of the Disneyland fireworks (though far away) if you are in the room that's on the left side of the corridor (I believe that's West).

Summary: This was the second time I had stayed at TownePlace Anaheim. Both time were very enjoyable. The hotel is clean and well kept up. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to everyone. There is an elevator for your convenience. The parking is free which is a plus. Most hotels in the area charge at least $10.00 a day because of the hotel being located near Disneyland and Anaheim Stadium.

Summary: the location was great. nice area. many restaurants close by. .rooms were clean.  excellent service. the staff was very friendly. pool was heated so that was a plus.  people complained about the train, I did not hear it once.  I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to a ball game.

The rooms are quite spacious and comes with a full kitchen, which is nice if you are doing extended stay. The hotel was nothing made for the business traveler however I think leisure travelers are all about it now. It was sold out for the night we were there which was a Saturday night.  Downside is that it is right next to the train tracks therefore do not sleep with your window open because the train horn is very very loud.

Summary Heading: 10 minute walk to Angel stadium and The Grove

We got back around 10:30pm after showering and I went to my suitcase and my CHANEL prescription glasses and case were gone! So I am very upset and disappointed  with this hotel. We did drive around a little to Disney and other sights as a secondary reason for our trip and it was rather accessible from both the city and the Santa Ana airport. However the kids went absolutely crazy for the train my son is really into Thomas the train at four years old every time we were in the room and the train came by he would jump up and down and yell "look at Thomas dad" which made me whole stay three times better. He keeps asking time and time again, dad when are we going back to see Thomas. So we will be staying here for Thomas when we come to Anaheim other then that the staff was great, the rooms were very clean and not much bad to say about the hotel they did have a convention going on when we check into

Summary Heading: Best Staff in the Hospitality Business
Summary: When in the area, I always stay at the TownePlace Suites in Anaheim.  Rachel Lei and her staff of professionals are the best in the business.  I spend at least a week a month on the road and wouldn't consider staying somewhere else.  You are greeted warmly upon checkin and throughout your stay.  My only complaint about this property is that others have discovered it, so I can't always get a room when I call to make a reservation.    I am very much a creature of habit, and some say have have the "Norm" (from Cheers) syndrome.  I like to go where "everybody knows my name, and they are always glad I came".  You will have this same feeling when you stay at the TownePlace Suites.

Summary Heading: Good value for money, despite the trains
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in July 2009. Booking and finding the hotel was easy. We booked a two bedroom suite, and due to our late arrival we got the last one available on that day, which was of course the worst one. Despite great suite and amenities, the room felt very damp - it was very hard to breathe. And the windows were overlooking the train line, which was very disappointing. The first night was pretty bad - trains would make a lot of noise and dampness of the room didn't help either. We contacted the reception right away, just after we checked in, and were very pleased that we were moved to another suite the next day. Staff were very good - polite and helpful, so the rest of our stay was great.  Bedrooms are very comfortable and big. It was an extremely good

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights in October 2009. Very close to the ball park, and even to Disney and highways. Rooms are the usual with a small kitchen. Most guests are for extended stay and cooking odors can be overwhelming. Train tracks  at the property line, goes by during the night. Not horribly loud, but light sleepers will notice. OK for a night but for longer, keep looking.

Summary Heading: Friendly, clean and affordable...home away from home.
Summary: Our family travelled from New Zealand to visit Ananheim and all of its attractions. We hired 3 rooms for 3 weeks. The hotel surpassed our expectations. The staff were always friendly, courteous, and willing to offer help to this bunch of downunder newcommers. The trains were only heard when we had the windows open, and certainly did not bother us at all at night. Free internet made it easy to keep in contact with those back home, and for pre buying tickets to places like Disneyland, Magic Mountain and Knotts Berry Farm. The only very small point of concern was that some of the refrigerator doors did not close properly, which caused some issues with our food and drinks...possible upgrade needed there. All in all...a great stay, and we would certainly recommend to others as well

Summary: This is not a luxury hotel, but a convenient and comfortable spot to stay.  It is literally across the street from Angel Stadium, Amtrak, and metrorail.  Not for the family going daily to Disneyland.

Now moving on...I always book 2-bedroom suites at Marriott hotels when we travel and we always get 2 separate bedrooms with 2 separate baths; not here.  Please beware, that all 2 bedroom suites here have only "1" bath.  We found this to be very inconvenient. The price was right ($90 per night with AAA discount).  However, upon check in they told us that as since were staying for 5 nights, we were considered to be "extended stay", so we would only get a full housekeeping service once during our stay, with one other "partial" (didn't change linens, etc...) service.  Not too good when you have four people coming in at the end of a long day, just wanting to shower and clean up. Summary: Very comfortable hotel with friendly staff. It is located right near the intersection of the 5 and 57 freeways. Very clean throughout. Marriott beds are the best. The only negative (small one) is the tiny, tiny fitness center: 1 bike, 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical crammed into a small room.

Summary Heading: Second visit and would come back again
Summary: This is our second stay at the Towne Place Suites. Clean and the staff was great. Free coffee in the morning, cookies in the afternoon, all enjoyed by my family over the 5 nights we were there. The staff was always ready to help. We stayed in a 2 bedroom which was nice, so when we put the boys to sleep we could hang out, watch tv, enjoy a few adult beverages and relax before the next day's assault on Disneyland.   Also, it was nice having the variety of eating options just a few minutes walk away. We never were bothered by the train and our boys enjoyed seeing go buy as we played in the pool. Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Would Gladly Stay Here Again
Summary: I have stayed here many times and echo the positive comments of the many other reviewers.  As I write this, I am sitting on the bed in the hotel looking at the TV and was very amused by the other review where the woman complains about how easy it is to access porn movies.
