Summary: If you need to work nearby or visit Disneyland, Edison Field or the  Arrowhead Pond then this hotel is for you. Full kitchen gives you all the  options to stay in for meals. And if not, just downstairs and very  close by, you will find Denny's, Panda, Fresca's and Starbucks. There's  even a fitness center there in case you ate too much and need to lose a  few pounds before heading home. For the budget-minded travellers,  McDonald's is across the street. Summary Heading: Mediocre Property, Cheap rates,  Not so clean
Summary: We stayed at Townplace Suites Anaheim for the first time last July 2005.   Good - The price was great for a large room with full kitchen (including dishwasher). Due note, however, that the amenities and quality of furnishings were more in-line with an Extended-Stay property (which is less than Residence Inn quality but is do-able). Hotel parking was free and is connected to a multi-use development that includes a Bally's Fitness Spa, Denny's Restaurant, Panda Express eatery, Carl's Jr and a bank with ATM service. Summary: If you don't want to spend too much, this is a nice place to stay. The location is perfect! Disneyland is only a few blocks away and a free shuttle bus comes to the hotel every half hour from 7am until midnight. The Angel stadium is within walking distance and you can take the bus to go to the Orange Outlet "The Block". However, no supermarket near by. Across the parking lot you have several restaurants, McDonalds, Denny's, Carl's Jr, etc. The room is simple but very clean, and the kitchen is bigger than what we expected. Big fridge, microwave, dishwasher, oven, a variety of pans, baking sheets, etc. Good hotel for the price. I would recommend it!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for one week while on vacation and overall this hotel was excellent based on their price, location and atmosphere.  The staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The room was large, comfortable and the kitchen had all the necessities that there was no need for me to purchase anything other than my food.  I  highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Anaheim.  I plan to stay at this location again in the future.

Summary: I will definately be staying at this hotel for my future Disneyland visits.  Fantastic value for the dollar. Summary Heading: Great accomodation, shame about the trains.
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 04 after visiting one in Cleveland and the suites are ideal if you want 2 separate bedrooms. The rooms are spacious, always clean, 3 televisions and its also great to have your own kitchen. The reception staff were good, we did not use the pool, but we did use the washing facileties, gym and internet services. The hotel has free parking and is located nearby some restaurants, Anaheim Angels baseball staduim, freeway access and few minutes drive from Disney. The only problem is the Amtrak trains which run directly behind the hotel and the traffic can be noisy as well, you do tend to ignore them after the third night and I made some ear plugs, but other than this problem, the accomodation is excellent.

Summary: We were very pleased with this place. Helpful staff, big, clean, comfortable suite. 2BR suite was perfect for 2 adults & 2 kids. (No breakfast, but it was a pleasant stroll to both Carl's & Starbucks - can't complain!) Great deal for the $ - would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Even thouth we had reserved a two room suite and confirmed a two room suite, we got a one room with a bed and a sofa. The room was so small that the sofa bed had to be folded up for people in the bed to move to the other side of the room.  Not what was expected of Marriott.  Fortunately, it was short trip and we had relatives near by or the family would have been at each others throats cramped up in there.

Summary: We Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from July 2 thru the 5th, very nice and clean, the rooms were big and spacious, front desk was very nice and provided me with everything I need. I would def. stay here again very convenient and well kept.

Summary: We got a 2 Bdrm suite, which was perfect for us. Close by to Disneyland (5 min drive).Our baby slept in a crib (provided by hotel with linens) in the living room, our older son had his own room, and my husband & I had a room. There were 3 tvs, a fold out sofa and a full kitchen. The pool and jacuzzi were nice. The only bad thing was the train going by, but we got used to it and it never caused us to wake up.  The staff was very friendly and quick to help.  Restaurants were close by but we brought our own snacks and drinks. Will definitely stay here again. My husband loved the morning delivery of newspaper and my son loved having his own room with a view of pool and train tracks.

Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment during our stay in Anaheim in June 2004. We have two young children (3 and 5). The apartment was clean and well equipped. The beds were comfy and the linen fresh. We loved the location, near Dennys, Starbucks, Panda Express and Mc Donalds. We made our booking on the net from Australia and found our requests had been answered perfectly. ( A corner non-smoking room). Another great feature was the free parking and free shuttle to Disneyland. There were three T.V.'s all having cable, which the kids loved. There was a bath, lots of towels. I highly recommend this hotel to families with young children, we were very impressed.
